POSITION:	Senior Financial/Business Intelligence Analyst
LOCATION: Midtown, Atlanta, GA
COMP.: $90k target though commensurate with experience
 
Responsibilities:

Work on budgets, forecasts (including financial modeling), and month end reviews. These will include performing variance analysis and formal write-ups. 
Collect data from Microsoft SQL Server, conduct ad hoc analysis/reporting, and create executive level presentations to share progress of business health specifically within the business unit.
Using advanced Microsoft Excel, turn data into actionable insights that would influence operational and strategic goals by which to drive the growth of the business. 
Should be well organized and have a proven track record of tackling complex business questions, mining data, and generating business relevant insights that are communicated effectively. 
Must also have strong attention to detail with the ability to quickly identify and resolve data issues/needs.



Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, other quantitative fields (MBA Preferred)
Experience with SQL queries required (at least the ability to edit/modify existing queries)
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server is required
2+ years progressive financial analysis experience
Strong Excel skills required
Must be comfortable with creating and maintaining complex financial models and developing business metrics
Intermediate to Advanced experience working in Word, and PowerPoint
Experience creating and developing automated reports and dashboards preferred
Comfortable sharing analysis insights and key findings to internal clients and executives

details:
Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Developer will assist in the design, development, and administrative control of all BI data extracts and reporting activity for Fulton County Schools. The developer will use critical thinking and analytical skills to plan, design, develop, test, coordinate, and implement business intelligence (BI) solutions for the District. Analyzes business, functional, and related issues to formulate and develop new or modified BI solutions. 
Create interfaces to exchange data to and from external systems. Coordinate solution test activities, analyzes test results, takes appropriate actions and completes the system documentation. 
Work directly with business owners to gather requirements and specifications. Performs quality assurance within the BI environment.



A minimum of 5 years of experience in development of BI/Data Warehouse solutions
Strong knowledge of Data Warehouse processes and Tabular Modeling concepts, with star and snowflake data models. Technical skills include experience with the Microsoft BI Stack including SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), Power BI Pro, Tabular modeling experience, and strong T-SQL and DAX skills. Experience with Azure Data Factory is a plus.

Strong T-SQL and DAX skills including advanced coding and performance and tuning 
Experience in dealing with complex and dirty data sources originating in multiple formats
Experience with data modeling, data analysis, data profiling and data mapping  
Experience with predictive and prescriptive analytics is a plus
Must have an understanding of general business practices, business analysis, requirements gathering 
Must have superior problem solving skills and techniques to resolve issues that arise with complex business systems

Ref ID: 02760-0010350580Classification: Database DeveloperCompensation: $125,000.00 to $130,000.00 per yearPOSITION SUMMARY: The BI Technical Lead will be responsible for working closely with the product owner to ensure reporting and design requirements are met. This person will be responsible for the training and mentoring of a group of Microsoft BI developers, and assigning tasks based on the priorities outlined by the product owner. The Technical Lead is responsible for ensuring the proper data is available to achieve the business objective for reporting and analysis across all areas of the enterprise. The technical domain includes conceptual, logical and physical data modeling, data standards, best practices, tool and technologies, data architecture, design, development, capacity planning, performance tuning, and administration. This role requires someone with strong technical backgrounds in data modeling tools as well as application development. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: ? Works with BI Specialist and development team to design, plan implement, evaluate and enhance system architecture. ? Provides direction and oversight of the process of conceptual and logical data modeling. ? Validates user requirements are supported by the database schema design. ? Performs detailed data analysis and source data quality assessment. ? Designs and develops entity and attributes model descriptions and definitions and ensures that conflicts in descriptions and definitions are resolved. ? Designs, develops and maintains the subject area models (integrated, analytical/dimensional). ? Responsible for developing information architectures and data models. ? Develops detailed technical designs and works with cross-functional teams to implement those designs. ? Assist business analysts and reporting tool specialists in configuring the reporting tool and building standard reports/queries. ? Leads the design of the schema and data dictionary (metadata). ? Identifies the appropriate data sources with Business. ? Performs the activities necessary to support the standardization of entities and attributes. ? Assists analysts in source to target mappings. Specifies appropriate access levels to the databases through SQL Server security ? Leads any system migrations and major upgrades

EXPERIENCE AND BACKGROUND REQUIREMENTS: ? 7+ years of experience in technical architecture and application delivery ? Worked in an Architect/Technical Lead level ? Trained junior developers ? AGILE experience preferred ? Depth and breadth of both knowledge and hands-on implementation experience with Microsoft BI Stack: Microsoft SQL 2014, SSIS, SSAS, SSRS. ? Proficient in creating and maintaining SSAS OLAP cubes following star schema patterns and dimensional modeling best practices in SQL Server 2012 or newer, as well as data partitioning. ? Understands Microsoft SQL Server error logging for troubleshooting and incident reporting; proficient in SQL Profiler for providing query traces ? Ability to lead and mentor development team. ? Excellent verbal and written communication skills. EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS: ? BS in Computer Science, Information Systems or related fieldTechnology doesn't change the world. Connections IT Services is now hiring a Microsoft Stack BI Analyst/Developer.  The Business Intelligence Developer/Analyst will be responsible for transforming data into actionable insight using the Microsoft SQL 2012+ stack of Business Intelligence products.  This will be a dynamic role where you will be an integral member of a small team building an end-to-end business intelligence solution. This person should be very analytical with an even mix of business acumen and technical capability.  Position ID:  CITS0570 Location:  Irving, TX Term:  FTE/CTH  Title:  Microsoft Stack BI Analyst  No Vendors Sponsorship is not available  To stand out as a candidate for this role you have the following skillsets:  SQL, SSRS Report Development (experience with other vendor tools will be considered), PowerPivot, Power View, Qlik Sense, SharePoint, DAX, Data warehouse experience (IBM Netezza – Pure Data for Analytics), Data Visualization, Tableau   Description  The ideal candidate will have an innate curiosity and some analytical capability with a passion for learning. An understanding of web analytics, compliance related reporting, and lending are a plus and experience in designing, developing and maintaining business intelligence solutions is preferred.  Role and Responsibility   The BI Developer will be responsible for working with analysts, managers, and executives to understand and document business needs and working with other IT groups and the data warehouse team to understand the data sources. This will be a collaborative role that will be responsible in designing, building and deploying the BI solutions (e.g. reports) and conduct testing and troubleshooting.     This person should be able to work independently and have a drive for excellence.    Should be able to develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses. Some experience with Qlik Sense, Power View, Essbase, SAS and visual analytics tools are nice to haves.   Required Skills   4+ SQL 4+ SSRS Report Development (experience with other vendor tools will be considered) 2+ PowerPivot, Power View, Qlik Sense, SharePoint, DAX 2+ Data warehouse experience (IBM Netezza – Pure Data for Analytics) Experience with Qlik Sense and Essbase is a plus.

title: Business Intelligence

details:
Alphanumeric is hiring a SENIOR BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST to work in Durham, NC. 


Responsible for leading the design and support of enterprise-wide business intelligence applications and architecture including analyzing business needs and translating them into technology as well as process solutions. Gather and analyze business requirements from internal customers, evaluate solution options, and develop recommendations in the form of functional specifications. 

The ideal candidate will have a background in finance and financial systems (Oracle Financials, Costpoint, Understanding of GNA business costs),  and has moved from developing IBM Cognos reports to a subject matter expert and consultant who is strong with the business aspects of Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse.

Key Responsibilities:




Work with Finance stakeholders to understand business needs and develop business acumen. 


Troubleshoot BI tools, systems, and software--IBM Cognos, Cognos reports.

Identify inefficiencies and gaps (data integrity, scalability, security, performance, manageability, etc.) in current BI environment and recommend solutions. 
Develop and maintain deep business and IT domain expertise for area of responsibility. 
Gather and analyze business requirements from stakeholders and, based on findings, design functional specifications for BI front-end applications.
Optimize the performance of enterprise business intelligence tools by defining data to filter and index that add value to the user. 

Design and coordinate a curriculum for coaching and training customers in the use of business intelligence tools to enhance business decision-making capability.  


Research new technology and develop business cases to support enterprise-wide business intelligence solutions. 


Work closely with the Data Architect to design solutions in support of BI efforts.  


Maintain strong knowledge of the data warehouse and reporting data models. 


Serve as a thought leader and implementation strategist for BI systems that deliver meaningful and actionable information to key business personnel. 


Design, develop and deliver a training curriculum to ensure end user success and promote use of the BI environment across the organization.


Mentor and coach junior staff and business users onBusiness Intelligence and reporting and data mining methodology. 


Develop functional specifications in conjunction with technical staff including inputs, outputs, logic, and other details necessary to implement a solution. 


Identify and separate needs for revamped or new business processes separate from technology solutions, and work with internal customers to create business processes. 


Develop user acceptance test plan to validate the installed configuration and operation against detailed functional specifications, and review test results. 

Develop and maintain relationships with peers in the course of developing solutions or solving problems.  
Work projects through to completion while keeping project team members, stakeholders, vendors and ITS management informed of issues and overall status. May coordinate small projects as well. 
Manage time utilization to ensure that tasks are completed on or ahead of schedule, and that issues are escalated to project or ITS management.
Maintain awareness of technology and industry trends sufficient to provide input to selection of technology solutions as well as development of tools and methodologies. 

Act as evangelist for BI benefits across the organization; promote BI usage to relevant departments






Bachelor’s degree in Finance, IT, or related field and 10 years of related experience; or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Finance background.
Strong knowledge of Cognos.


Ability to multi-task, work well with others, listen and communicate well both verbally and in writing, work independently.
Attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to obtain proper security clearances as noted by contracts.

General knowledge of/skills in:

software development methodologies.
developing system standards by applying industry knowledge to business needs by maintaining knowledge of information technology and research institute standards, which may include application, business intelligence, or database standards.

participating in planning, design, or implementation activities under the direction of project leaders while completing tasks in the prescribed time and reporting status or issues to project leaders.

identifying and documenting business needs, rules and functions following standard ITS processes, defining scope of work and obtaining end user department sign off.

technology marketplace and direction for technologies relevant to one’s areas of expertise or relevant to a specific set of project requirements.

researching and evaluating vendor offerings either for products of services meeting business and/or technical requirements, developing vendor selection criteria and, in conjunction with others, developing final recommendation on offerings.

coordinating projects providing scope definition, risk analysis, and status updates to appropriate parties, as well as leadership to the project team.





Basic knowledge of or skills in planning, designing, developing and documenting functional requirements, including the end users’ view of the system, underlying data structures and system interfaces, supplying sufficient specifications to develop or purchase needed software and acquire a hardware platform.

details:
Connections IT Services is now hiring a Microsoft Stack BI Analyst/Developer.  The Business Intelligence Developer/Analyst will be responsible for transforming data into actionable insight using the Microsoft SQL 2012+ stack of Business Intelligence products. This will be a dynamic role where you will be an integral member of a small team building an end-to-end business intelligence solution. This person should be very analytical with an even mix of business acumen and technical capability.
 
Position ID:  CITS0570
Location:  Irving, TX
Term:  FTE/CTH
 
Title:  Microsoft Stack BI Analyst
 
No Vendors
Sponsorship is not available
 
To stand out as a candidate for this role you have the following skillsets:
 
SQL, SSRS Report Development (experience with other vendor tools will be considered), PowerPivot, Power View, Qlik Sense, SharePoint, DAX, Data warehouse experience (IBM Netezza – Pure Data for Analytics), Data Visualization, Tableau
 
 
Description

The ideal candidate will have an innate curiosity and some analytical capability with a passion for learning. An understanding of web analytics, compliance related reporting, and lending are a plus and experience in designing, developing and maintaining business intelligence solutions is preferred.


Role and Responsibility
 
·       The BI Developer will be responsible for working with analysts, managers, and executives to understand and document business needs and working with other IT groups and the data warehouse team to understand the data sources. This will be a collaborative role that will be responsible in designing, building and deploying the BI solutions (e.g. reports) and conduct testing and troubleshooting.
 
·       This person should be able to work independently and have a drive for excellence.
 
·       Should be able to develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses. This person must be able to communicate well verbally and written and must exercise the importance of documentation.
 
·       This person should be at near expert level with SQL and be familiar with concepts like common table expressions, RANK, CASE, sub-queries, etc.
 
·       Must be familiar with pulling data out of data warehouse Dim/Fact tables as well as unstructured data and 3rd party data and marrying them together to get an overall view of the business.
 
·       A couple of years of SSRS experience is necessary with detailed understanding of expressions, data driven subscriptions, drill-down, drill-through, sub-reports, parameters, and report objects like tables, matrix, charts, maps, etc.…
 
·       Familiarity and some experience with PowerPivot are needed including creating data visualizations to support business monitoring, complex DAX expressions, and performance tuning PowerPivot and Tabular data models. Some experience with Qlik Sense, Power View, Essbase, SAS and visual analytics tools are nice to haves.
 
Required Skills
 
·       4+ SQL
·       4+ SSRS Report Development (experience with other vendor tools will be considered)
·       2+ PowerPivot, Power View, Qlik Sense, SharePoint, DAX
·       2+ Data warehouse experience (IBM Netezza – Pure Data for Analytics)
·       Experience with Qlik Sense and Essbase is a plus.

title: Business Intelligence

details:
This hands-on position will report to our Business Intelligence Manager and be part of the team maintaining and operating the Data Warehouse and BI reports. This includes ETL activities using Microsoft SSIS/SQL, reporting (SSRS) and analytics (SSAS). This person will also be responsible for developing a working knowledge of Cottonwood’s business model and database structures for new solutions.  This position is based at our Corporate Office (HQ) in Irving (Las Colinas), Texas.


COMPENSATION

Annual salary of $102,000

 BENEFITS 

Medical, dental, and vision
Voluntary life/ AD&D
Short-term & long-term disability
401K with company match
Paid vacation, holidays, and sick time
Paid maternity, paternity, extended medical leave, and jury duty
Corporate discount program on personal cell phone accounts with select providers
Business casual work environment




Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Management Information Systems, or related field
6+ years of advanced experience in designing, developing BI solutions with Microsoft BI technology (SSRS/SSIS)
Experience with successfully implementing Kimball data warehousing methodology
Knowledge of Relational and Dimensional data modeling 
Proficient in the use of advanced level T-SQL for developing complex stored procedures, triggers, tables, functions, indexes, etc.
Knowledge of Database Administration for Microsoft SQL Server in an Enterprise environment
Local (Dallas/Fort Worth area) candidates only – no relocation
Must be currently authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship and not require sponsorship in the future


 PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Experience with SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS)
Experience developing and/or administering data visualization tools such as Tableau, QlikView or Power BI
Experience with Microsoft Office products: Office, Excel, Visio, etc.
Problem solver; can quickly assess a situation then develop and implement effective solutions 
Conduct requirements gathering sessions with business stakeholders and develop business / technical requirements
Proficient in developing and executing test plans including unit and regression testing
Able to quickly grasp both technology and business concepts in an ever-changing environment
Can troubleshoot BI Environment problems and tune for performance optimization
Ability to create technical documentation of infrastructure and processes
Excellent customer service, interpersonal, verbal and written communication, and team collaboration skills
Exposure to BIML/Mist
Data science experience using Python machine learning, R statistical modeling, or Data Mining techniques is a plus
Solid knowledge and application of System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) 
Previous development experience using an Agile methodology
Financial or retail industry experience is a plus
Experience with cloud-based BI Solutions

 ABOUT COTTONWOOD 
Founded in 1996, Cottonwood Financial is one of the largest privately held retail consumer finance companies in the consumer finance industry.  We have zero debt, have been profitable every year since inception, and our growth is funded entirely through internally generated capital.  Headquartered in Irving (Las Colinas), Texas, we have company-owned locations, under our Cash Store brand, across the country.  Through this national brick-and-mortar footprint, we provide best-in-class customer service and offer an innovative mix of financial products and services to our customers.

We have been named several times to the Inc. 5000 list of America’s fastest-growing private companies, as well as to the Dallas 100 list of the fastest-growing private companies in North Texas.

details:
Randstad is thrilled to partner with one of our premier global clients based in Washington, DC, on a dynamic opportunity for a Financial Analyst with strong Business Intelligence. The Financial Analyst/BI will provide financial and administrative support for moderately complex to complex projects and is involved with pre-award activities such as pricing, new business analytics, market analysis; direct and indirect project cost control, cost and price analysis, and budgeting and forecasting. The FA/BI will be proficient in the performance of all financial activities related to the life cycle of multi-dimensional, large, long-term projects, ranging through initial business capture/development activities, pricing/cost estimating, budget preparation, project execution and project completion/closeout.
Responsibilities
- Provide financial intelligence and act as point-of-contact to the financial Planning and Analysis team for all corporate budgeting, forecasting and reporting activities related to Practice Area and Strategy Office finances.
- Lead monthly and quarterly financial reporting and analysis of new business financial key performance indicators.
- Develop and maintain forecasting models with focus on key performance indicator trends and variances.
- Under guidance, provide basic financial support and analysis of external organizations targeted for acquisition or business combination.
- Analyze bid and pipeline data for completeness and accuracy; initiate changes where required.
- Provide bidding support to proposal teams including review of bid costs for competitiveness and
completeness.
- Prepare budgets and related updates indirect expenditures.
Qualifications
- Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration or related field is required.
- Master's degree in Finance, Business Administration or related field is a plus.
- Minimum of 3-5 years of relevant work experience in an organization offering services to federal, state and commercial clients; experience in an organization delivering IT products and services is a plus.
- Problem-solver with strong analytical and organizational skills
- Fine attention to detail, responsiveness, and demonstrated ability to deal with confidential information
- Experience with large complicated budgets; experience with Business Intelligence reporting tools or Tableau a plus.
- Expert level of proficiency in Microsoft Office, including Excel and PowerPoint is required.
- Flexibility with demonstrated ability to support multiple projects concurrently and consistently meet deadlines is required.
- Entrepreneurial with ability to work within structured and unstructured environments.
- Ability to work independently as well as part of a team is required.
- Ability to communicate - both in writing and in person - clearly, concisely and persuasively is required.
- Knowledge of Deltek Costpoint is a plus.

details:
We are seeking a solutions oriented and experienced Sr. Power BI developer to join the business intelligence team and support a fast growing Power BI initiative. The Power BI developer will create reports and dashboards for Enterprise use, and ensure the underlying data models are governed and promote a single source of truth for reporting. This role will also stay updated on all upcoming features and capabilities of Power BI to make sure we are maximizing the potential of the tool. Additionally, this role will collaborate with the infrastructure team to review, test, and release all needed upgrades to power BI gateway, and power BI desktop software. And as the resident expert on Power BI, this role will provide guidance to our community of power users/citizen developers on best practices in building great reports, dashboards, and data models.
Key Responsibilities:

·       Design and develop intuitive and visually appealing reports, and dashboards using Microsoft Power BI.

·       Participate in requirements gathering and  illustratration of  designs using wireframes.

·       Create, review and analyze complex, integrated data models and information from various sources (ERP, CRM, EDW, and Power BI Service, etc.).

·       Documentation of business and IT solutions, business process functional and nonfunctional requirements and problems. 

·       Collaborate and facilitate communication between business stakeholders and the various IT groups.

·       Conduct day-to-day client communications. Build credibility and trust. Promote transparency. Manage expectations.

·       Manages the Power BI environment, Enhancements and support of Power BI applications.

·       Performs hands on developer activities as needed, need SQL development experience SSIS, SSAS, SSRS.

·       Consistently demonstrate and promote company core values at all times.
General Requirements:
 



Must be inherently empathetic to business needs and have ability to influence and negotiate through to solutions that make appropriate trade-offs between project delivery efficiency and adherence to IT strategies.





Ability to design and develop in an Agile delivery environment. This includes understanding minimum viable product from both the business and IT standpoint to ensure delivered solutions support future features without rework.





Strong communication, presentation and interpersonal skills amongst key stakeholders. Skilled in preparing and delivering documentation such as data flow, logical, and physical diagrams consumption by IT stakeholders.





Self-confident with the demonstrated ability to drive change and challenge the status quo





Strong knowledge of relative systems and 5+ years background in BI development.





Ability to build data models and describe data lineage relationships.





Facilitation, conflict management, negotiation, and consensus building skills




High energy, creative, self-motivated and independent


Qualifications and Experience:

 

Experience:

·       3-5 years of significant software development experience, designing, developing and supporting intuitive reports, dashboards, and graphs using Azure Power BI Service, Power BI Desktop, Azure Analysis Services, DAX Query Language, SSAS, Visual Studio, SSDT and Excel Pivot.

·       3-5 Years of relevant experience gathering requirements, interfacing with stakeholders, and supporting large Business Intelligence / Data Warehouse applications.

·       Experience and thorough understanding of Tabular, Multidimensional, Security Models, Dimensional Structures, Hierarchies, and Big Data / Business Intelligence / Data Warehouse best practices and standards.

·       Experience leading meetings, and the creation of presentations, status reports, specifications document, and technical design documents.

·       Strong analytical skills and experience with the SDLC methodologies such as Waterfall and Agile.

·       Self-motivated, proactive, detail-oriented, and can work independently as well as in a team environment.

 

Education:

·       Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology related field.

·       Microsoft Azure Power BI Certification preferred.

Business Intelligence Engineer – Microsoft SSRS/ SSIS (Charlotte, NC)

Optomi, in partnership with an industry leading pharmaceutical company, is seeking a BI Engineer for their Charlotte, NC location. This BI Engineer/Analyst will be reporting into the Application Development Manager, this position is responsible for working with business stakeholders to define and document business processes and software requirements for technology requests. This individual will regularly engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously across all levels in an organization. This will include teaming with IT developers, business key users, validation and QA staff.

What the right candidate will enjoy:

Exposure to the latest and greatest Microsoft and Microstrategy BI technology stack!
Rapid career growth opportunity working with a highly regarded engineering team
Flexible work hours!
Company sponsored training and certification reimbursement program!


Responsibilities:

Collect, analyze and interpret requirements using interviews, document analysis, business process descriptions, business analysis, and task and workflow analysis toward best practice or BABOK standards.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Proactively communicate, collaborate, and facilitate knowledge transfer between internal customers and development team to analyze information needs and functional requirements.
Clearly and concisely document the results of analysis and workflows as well as obtain sign-off from the internal customers.
Assist technical writer in the design of test scripts and test scenarios. Coordinate with the business users who test, validate, and evaluate new applications and functions, and determine issues in services and software.
Serve as the conduit between the internal customer community and the software development team through which requirements flow.

Function:Design and develop various components of the Business Intelligence environment at the Bank, including the data warehouse and related decision support facilities. Perform the activities related to the design, development, documentation, and support of the Bank's data warehouse data model / architecture and the establishment of policies and procedures pertaining to its management, maintenance, and utilization. Set and monitor standards related to the data warehouse data model. Assist the business intelligence architect and project manager in the management of the Bank's data warehouse environment.Essential Duties:

Provide the necessary level of self-management and task control to keep all assigned projects on schedule.
Perform preliminary project analysis and document findings in the manner required by department standards
Design, develop, maintain and document the components of the Business Intelligence environment.
Work with architects to translate requirements into technical specifications. Helps identify and assess potential data sources.
Analyze, design & develop ETL jobs and reports.
Identify data quality issues.
Design, implement and document data warehouse schemas using Bank's standard technology tools Report development in BusinessObjects Enterprise Web Intelligence & Crystal Reports.
Develop Scheduler jobs
Develop, manage, schedule, and document data warehouse operations and tasks, including extraction, movement, loading, archival, security, backup, and aggregate table creation.
Test, monitor, manage and validate data warehouse activity, including data extraction, transformation, movement, loading, cleansing, and updating processes.
Provide full support for the Bank's business intelligence environment. Support includes but is not limited to: problem resolution (business and non-business hours); user support; and system maintenance.
Support the Bank's application development process.
Assist project managers and end users in identifying and recommending automated solutions to business problems.
Assist the database administrator where appropriate in troubleshooting performance issues in Oracle data warehouse
Monitor business use and performance of the data warehouse and provides feedback to data warehouse architects, developers, and database administrators.
Ensure the data warehouse meets service level requirements.

details:
Virginia Farm Bureau's Information Services department, located in Richmond, Virginia is seeking a highly collaborative, team orientated Business Intelligence Analyst. This position is responsible for enterprise data integration and reporting.   As Virginia Farm Bureau's new BI Analyst, you will showcase your talents by the following:

Build, develop, and manage SQL Server relational databases using data warehousing best practices
Design architecture, map business rules and processes into technical solutions
Hands-on ETL development. Review ETL load jobs coded by others for consistency and quality
Gather business requirements to conceptualize, design and deliver ongoing production reports and visual dashboards
Mine and manipulate data from the enterprise data warehouse, along with other disparate sources, to provide data reporting for business operational reports and analyses using a variety of analytical tools, including but not limited to: SQL, SSRS, SAS, Power BI, Excel, or related BI software
Ensure that proper controls are in place so that reports are accurate and timely; resolve any issues/errors
Work closely with the team to translate raw enterprise data into meaningful analyses and insights 
Collaborate with team on developing a consistent approach to BI reports/dashboards used throughout the company; provide suggestions to improve reporting best practices and work as part of team responsible for ongoing process improvement efforts
Support the ongoing development of the enterprise data warehouse through the identification of new data sources and continued validation of existing data sources 
Support the day-to-day performance, maintenance, and monitoring of SQL environments and interfaces




Qualifications Include:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, management information systems, statistics, or related program or 4 years' equivalent academic and work experience’
Experience with SQL Server, SSIS, SSRS & SSAS 
Ability to compute, analyze and interpret complex and disparate data to produce relevant and consumable reports, dashboards, etc.
Self-starter with proven ability to stay organized and multi-task in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities without sacrificing quality
Strong desire to learn new technologies related to Business Intelligence and data warehousing
Strong interpersonal and communication skills
Detail oriented and committed to accuracy, data integrity and quality

Benefits Include:

Ongoing training, development and support in all roles
Medical and dental insurance on your first day
Generous employee “401K” contribution and PTO plan
Additional perks such as on-site gym, beautiful campus, Food Truck Tuesday’s, volunteer opportunities and more!  

For more information about our company, culture and this position, visit us online at www.vafb.com/careers

The BI Developer supports the department and company by maintaining and improving BI tools and processes that consolidate information from over a dozen independent IT systems and applications as well as developing and supporting new processes and data in a business that always strives to move forward. title: Business Intelligence

details:
Our client has an immediate need for a Business Intelligence/ETL SQL Developer to join their growing technology team. This is a permanent, full-time position. They have a number of different processes and databases that serve a variety of business units, and they have recognized the need to begin providing a standardized set of tools, including self-service solutions. Their current toolset includes: 
SSIS, SQL Server, Visual Studio
Microsoft Azure (Azure SQL, Azure Tables, etc.)
Tableau, Power BI 

Description: Work to load a variety of data into databases, while working with business users and software developers to make that information available for queries, reports and custom software applications. The right candidate will have deep technical skills, be comfortable working in and contributing to a nascent data infrastructure, and be excited about building a strong data foundation for the company. Responsibilities: 
Extract and import datasets from various data sources for use in custom software applications and future self-service analytic platforms.
Monitor, troubleshoot and support a wide range of extraction processes and datasets used across the company.
Assist with database performance optimization and interoperability issues.
Work with business users in creating extracts, queries and reports in response to requests for specific data. 

Requirements: The ideal candidate would be an engineer with a background in data and business analysis. Should have strong technical and programming skills. In order to be successful in this role, must have extensive experience with: 
Creating SSIS packages to load into relational and dimensional models
ETL and Data Integration monitoring, troubleshooting and maintenance
SQL Server, both on-prem and cloud-based offerings
Creating and troubleshooting T-SQL queries & stored procedures
Data warehouse design principles (Kimball Methodology); OLAP and relational database architecture 
Additionally, experience with the following is preferred but not required:
The rest of the Microsoft BI tool suite (SSAS Tabular Model, SSRS, MDS)
Data visualization and interaction tools (Tableau, Power BI)
Version control (Git)
Automated release and deployment tools (Visual Studio database projects, VSTS Release Management)
Working in an Agile environment (Scrum, Kanban, etc.)
We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

Core duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

1. Lines and pads crates and assembles cartons.

2. Obtains and sorts product.

3. Helps the Machine Operator as needed. They both work in a team of 2.

4. Wraps protective material around product.

5. Inserts product into boxes or fills containers as needed

6. Weighs containers and adjusts quantity.

7. Nails, glues, tapes or close boxes.

8. Labels containers, container tags, or products.

9. Sorts bundles or filled boxes.

10. Packs special arrangements or selections of product.

11. Inspects materials, propaganda, etc at each step of packaging process.

12. Records information such as weight, time, and date packaged.

Training and assistance will be provided during the initial period to learn how to work and assist the Machine Operator.

details:
OBIEE Developer/Admin
Type: Contract ( until Dec 2018) Location: Tampa, FL  At this time, we can only consider candidates that do not require sponsorship.   POSITION SUMMARY  The role of the OBIEE Developer/Admin is to design, develop and maintain Business Intelligence Applications (which can include complex reports, interactive dashboards, OLAP and Data Mining Analytics) by providing technical solutions in support of business objectives and ongoing operations.

The Successful candidate will have the ability to work with internal customers/end users to define and gather requirements to deliver BI Solutions.

Must be able to utilize and effectively communicate technical components of an initiative to applicable parties.  This role will be responsible for working with Other BI tools such as PowerBI, Microstrategy Etc.   • The OBIEE Developer will be responsible for the design, development and maintenance activities of the business intelligence applications for an enterprise data warehouse environment.  • Collaborate with business users to capture & define business requirements and then contribute to designing and defining the appropriate data warehouse dimensional modeling solution, which includes prototyping/demonstrating BIsolutions  • Design, develop and implement BI metadata/logical data models  • Design, develop and implement complex BI user interface objects (e.g. reports, analytics, ad-hoc queries, dashboards etc.  • Design and support BI security model  • Develop technical design documents and BI specifications that incorporate BI development standards & best practices 


 EXPERIENCE/SKILLS  • Experience designing, developing and supporting Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition (OBIEE) solution
• Strong ability to communicate, verbally and written, technical requirements/constraints to a broad audience of technical and non-technical individuals
• Oracle Exadata database experience strongly preferred
• Strong technical knowledge of OBIEE admin/metadata tools, security, user interface designs, development and deployment of dashboards, analytics and performance management reports • Ability to design logical and multi-dimensional data models
• Ability to design and develop OBIEE Metadata Repository and identify areas of optimization • Ability to design, build, deploy and support end to end BI solutions
• Advanced knowledge of data warehouse development and maintenance lifecycle and methodology • Strong PL/SQL and SQL development and performance tuning skills

Experience with Oracle DBMS preferably Oracle 11g

 EDUCATION:  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a related area is preferred

details: The incumbent will possess experience using innovative data visualization and analysis tools, such as Tableau, Microsoft PowerBI, HTML5, SharePoint, SSRS to produce insightful and attractive dashboards and data visualizations to highlight key business information allowing for faster more informed decisions. You will leverage your expertise to advise your fellow team members as you participate in strategic projects furthering the evolution of our visual analytics capability; you will use this power to turn millions of bits of information from bits of information into simple and powerful stories and actionable insights. In addition we are looking for a candidate that can consult and advise on business intelligence best practices as well as the latest trends and technology being leveraged today across leading organizations. Additional responsibilities include: * Responsible for developing business requirements and translating business needs into moderately complex analyses and projects for a department or functional area. * Designing and developing Tableau reports and dashboards including creating and tuning Tableau Data Extracts and maximizing performance through SQL performance tuning (analyze data models, data relationships, and dependencies). * Suggesting best visualization choices and display based on industry best practices and ease of user adoption. * Produce visuals and dashboards to convey the story inside the data * Data analysis skills - ability to dig in and understand complex models and business processes. * Compiles and mines data from multiple, cross business sources. Chester Upland School District is in a historic period of change.  We are uniquely poised to re-focus and transform into a student-focused district where each child is ensured the academic and personal skills to succeed in the college or career of their choice.
 
The senior leadership team is building a talented and committed team to ensure all students are prepared to graduate Chester Upland schools career and college ready!
 
Screening Procedures:

Receipt of a completed application, resume and cover letter
A minimum of two current written letters of reference from previous or current directors, principal, and supervisors
Personal interview

Qualifications:

Completion of Credential of Competency for Special Education Para educators in Pennsylvania, or possession of an associate’s degree
Previous experience working with children
Required Act 34, 141 and FBI clearances, physical and proof of U. S. citizenship or legal resident alien status.

It is the responsibility of the applicant to provide appropriate documents in support of the completed application prior to the application deadline.

Ideal Candidate:

Must possess interest and compassion for children
Ability to work well/interact with students, staff and members of the school community
Ability to follow directions, assist with classroom activities under teacher’s direction
Must possess good judgment and have strong written and verbal communication skills
Bilingual Preferred

General Duties

Prepare work materials
Work with students in small groups or individually
Supervise students at meal times and recess
Supervise arrival and dismissal times
Work with attendance records, report cards and other student records

The above list of duties and responsibilities is not intended to be all-inclusive and may be expanded to include other duties or responsibilities that the Chester Upland School District, the building principal or the classroom teacher may deem necessary from time to time.

Optomi, in partnership with a leading global asset management and financial services company is seeking a Data Engineer for their Owings Mills, MD locations.  

 The Data Engineer will be joining a team that will help create, maintain and optimize a new cloud-based data architecture that will support multiple investment business lines and will make architectural and design recommendations that will help facilitate the determination Buy/Sell investment decisions in a highly dynamic team environment.  







What the right professional will enjoy!!
●  Help establish best practices in big data technologies and data warehouse to collect and analyze large volumes of data advancing the state of the art in efficiency optimization, predictive analytics and BI self-reporting tools.
●  Join an emerging technical team of data engineers delivering a wide array of big data and self-service reporting solutions that use cutting edge technologies
●  Help guide the organization in efficient data and resource management best practices with cloud based big data, Data Warehouse and Reporting platforms and services

Apply today if your background includes:
●  You have a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science (or related field) and have 5+ years of relevant work experience in business intelligence, data engineering, data warehousing, or a similar field.
●  You remain active in learning emerging practices and technologies in the BI/DW and data science space.
●  You are comfortable and confident in your knowledge of multiple database programming languages and your knowledge of relational and columnar databases.
●  You have experience integrating data from multiple data sources and have processed large amounts of unstructured data.
●  You have experience with AWS, Big Data Components (Apache Spark, Hadoop, Presto, etc.), and Continuous Integration tools (TeamCity, Octopus, Jenkins, etc.) is desired, but not required.

Data Engineer Job Responsibilities:
●  Provide significant contributions to the growth of our Data infrastructure
●  Design, develop, test and deploy business intelligence solutions
●  Design and document data structures/models and data flows
●  Interact with various business units and technical teams to gather requirements
●  Review, optimize and document current ETL processes
●  Ensure data quality, completeness, and accuracy
●  Collaborate with team members in code reviews, discovering better practices and patterns and continuous improvements

details:
The Business Solutions Analyst works closely with administrative functional teams and leaders to identify and build process efficiencies using technology. A Solutions Analyst will configure application workflows (e.g. SalesForce), provide training and customer support, conduct business requirements gathering, and implement solution design. This role requires a strong IT professional capable of pivoting between multiple technologies to configure systems with the goal of supporting and enhancing operational processes (e.g. Human Resources, Payroll, Business Intelligence, Budgeting, Reporting, Grants Management, Procurement, Expense Reimbursement, and Advancement).
 JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: 

Evaluating business processes, anticipating requirements, investigating areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
Developing and configuring workflow solutions to support unique business requirements.
Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies.
Staying up-to-date on the latest processes and IT advancements to automate and modernize systems.
Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.
Performing requirements analysis.
Communicating insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management.
Working closely with clients, technicians, and managerial staff.
Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements.
Performing user acceptance testing.
Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance.
Updating, implementing and maintaining procedures.
Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements.
Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and information technology.
Managing competing resources and priorities.
 JOB QUALIFICATIONS: 

A Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Business or a related field.
A minimum of 3-5 years of experience in business analysis or an IT-related field.
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
Ability to influence and work with stakeholders to determine acceptable solutions.
Advanced technical skills (e.g. Database, Microsoft Windows, and SAAS experience).
Excellent documentation and verbal skills.
Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.
Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook.
 ADDITIONAL (VALUED) QUALIFICATIONS: 

SalesForce configuration or development experience.
Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI, Adaptive Insights).
ERP software (Microsoft NAV, Sage Intacct, Workday, PeopleSoft, NetSuite).
Knowledge of SQL databases and query language, Excel expertise.
Experience in business processes and data analysis.

Company:  This dynamic, rapidly growing company is a strong player in the logistics industry.  Throughout their history they have built a strong track record of excellence, holding fast to their top notch customer service values by providing innovative technology solutions that focus on the customer.  They operate in a team environment from top to bottom.  This company is dedicated to creating a fun, collaborative atmosphere where their employees can thrive. They are an outstanding, customer focused company that takes pride in their employees. 


This company appreciates their employees
In addition to creating a great work-life balance, this company has a superior benefits package which includes:

Outstanding Medical, Dental, and Vision Packages
401k with match
Life insurance
Christmas bonus



The Role You Will Play
We are looking for an outstanding Business Analyst who is the best in the game.

You are a critical member of the team who drives projects forward, working well in a collaborative team environment while also being a great leader. 
You are a Programmer who is a strong troubleshooter and analyst who understands the needs and experience of the end-user. 
With a background in billing/accounting, you are well versed in Business Intelligence tools (e.g. Crystal Reports, Microsoft BI, Tableau, Sisense, or Cognos Analytics).

You should have experience with resilient, redundant, and performant systems, and know how to optimize at scale.Be pragmatic: Handling multiple projects at the same time is a daily occurrence; you must be able to assess tradeoffs in an efficient manner and handle deliverables on short deadlinesStrive for innovation: Continuous learning is essential to this role; you are encouraged to add to our institutional knowledge and find ways to incorporate the latest and the greatest in our systemBe a team player: Everything happens within a team; you will have the opportunity to work with domain experts (understand domains and users), product managers (define roadmaps and scopes), and the broader engineering team (creates infrastructures and features essential for our models)What You Need for this PositionBS in CS or related field5+ years of industry experience building data pipelines, analytics systems, business intelligence reports, database internals, or distributed processing enginesStrong in JavaStrong in concurrent programmingStrong understanding of relational databasesExperience with frameworks like Spark, MapReduce, Hive, Pig at scaleExperience with distributed systems, scalability, and fault toleranceExperience with end-to-end performance profiling and optimization (Java, database, OS, network)Amazon Web Services experience highly desirableWhat's In It for YouGreat salary, annual performance bonus, sign on bonus and equity in a fast-growing company.Medical / Dental / Vision; 401k; pre-tax commuter benefit.Take time off as needed, we belief in a great-work-life balanceCasual, open office environment and fully stocked kitchen.If you are a Senior Analytics Engineer who has experience working with Spark and building out world class data pipelines, ETL Systems and real-time data, please apply today or send me your resume (Word.doc preferred) to Please click the 'Apply Online' button to apply.Thank you!

title: Business Intelligence

details:
Career Evolutions is searching for a Data Engineer to join a fast-growing, profitable, high-tech company based in Scottsdale, AZ. Full-time, direct hire opportunity with compensation up to $95K.

If you’re looking to join a profitable, entrepreneurial organization where you’ll work with passionate and energetic owners and employees working together towards a common goal of building world class solutions for their customers, then this is the perfect opportunity for you!

SUMMARY
You have great problem solving and communication skills and is comfortable with fast paced design, development and deployment in an agile environment. You will work extensively on data integration and reporting projects and will recommend solutions for and also develop clients’ data analysis solutions from the ground up. You are self-directed and comfortable supporting the data needs of multiple teams, systems and products. You are excited by the prospects of optimizing or even re-designing the company’s data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives.

RESPONSIBILITIES•    Study system flow, data usage and user workflows to develop solutions for both internal and external customers•    Gather and process raw data at scale, including writing scripts, calling APIs, writing SQL queries, etc.•    Work with software engineers to integrate innovations and solutions into production systems•    Process unstructured data into a form suitable for analysis – and also perform the analysis•    Use existing and available customer data to develop predictive/decision assistive customer reports•    Working on fast iteration cycles and tight deadlines using an agile/scrum methodology•    Support business decisions with ad hoc analysis

REQUIREMENTS•    BS CS, MIS, CIS, or equivalent combination of education and related experience•    Solid foundation in statistics, mathematics, and quantitative analysis•    3+ years T-SQL, Data Engineering, Data Science•    Experience with data warehousing, data analysis, and business intelligence applications•    Familiarity with R, Hadoop, Spark, Splunk, and other big-data related languages/technologies•    Exceptional problem solving & debugging skills•    Self-starting/directing – able to take a project idea and run with it from concept to completion•    Experience in cross platform application development and integration•    Experience working with datasets that exceed 500 million rows•    Strong analytical and documentation skills

Founded in 2008, Career Evolutions is a leading Executive Search Firm based in Scottsdale, Arizona. Career Evolutions provides products and services to identify top talent, develop employees, and maximize human capital to enhance the bottom line. For more info, please visit www.careerevolutions.net, check out our Current Opportunities, and contact us via phone 480.626.5253

• 3+ years T-SQL, Data Engineering, Data Science
• Experience with data warehousing, data analysis, and business intelligence applications
• Familiarity with R, Hadoop, Spark, Splunk, and other big-data related languages/technologies

details:
Our Eastern Operations Center in Parsippany, NJ is currently recruiting for a Technical Business Analyst. As a Technical Business Analyst, you will have responsibility for capturing business data, building business models, and processing solutions to address business needs.In this role, you will gather data, identify structure and context, extrapolate the insights and create reports. Produce financial, market and operational analysis by querying data repositories and generating periodic reports. Devise methods for identifying data patterns and trends in available information sources. Provides reports on financial and performance measures on both a recurring and ad-hoc basis.Functions:
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Developing database solutions to store and retrieve company information
Extract data from databases and data warehouses for reporting and to facilitate sharing between multiple data systems
Assist in the design and development of data warehouses and other database components to support Business Intelligence dashboards and reporting
Provide recurring and ad-hoc reports as required on financial and performance measures;
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Analyzes and interprets financial and operating data for management including performance benchmark reporting, cost analyses, market niche reporting, profitability analyses, performance assessments, contract pricing analyses, wage analyses, and other reporting as required
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Standardize data collection by developing methods for database design and validation reports
Synthesize current business trends or data to support recommendations for action
Analyzes and interprets trends; identifies and communicates loss trends; recommends corrective actions to stem immediate shortfalls while addressing long-term profitability issues.
Oversees and coordinates financial programs for funding new and continued operations in order to increase productivity and maximize profitability
Provide application analysis and data modeling design to collect data for a centralized data warehouse.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Work with team members and functional leads to understand existing data requirements and validation rules to support moving operational data into data warehouse
Other duties as assigned by management
Education/Experience:
Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field, and a minimum of three years progressively responsible business experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to perform the essential functions of the job, as determined by the company
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc) and databases (SQL etc)
Programming language (JAVA, Python, Ruby, XML, Java, ETL frameworks, VBA)
Competencies :
Strong understanding of business intelligence tools, databases, systems and methods
Skill in financial and operational analysis
Demonstrated knowledge of ethical business practices
Ability to think strategically, synthesize complex business/financial data and develop solutions
Ability to interact effectively at all levels and across diverse cultures
Ability to be an effective member of complex project teams
Ability to use financial systems and standard office applications software effectively

details:
TM1 DeveloperOur client is in need of a TM1 Developer. This position is responsible for supporting the business intelligence systems used by the FP&A and accounting departments. The main responsibility of the role is to administer, develop and optimize the IBM Cognos TM1 OLAP database server. In addition to the TM1 system there are several other ancillary systems that require development and support, namely, Citrix, Excel, SharePoint, SQL Server (Database, Queries, SSIS, MDS) and Financial share drives. The position requires strong analytical and financial modeling skills, advanced OLAP and Business Intelligence skills and a good understanding of financial and accounting fundamentals.  Daily responsibilities: 
Act as the primary system administrator to support and enhance the Business Intelligence and Reporting systems for the Finance department
Provide level 2 client support for 250+ US, Canada, and European based TM1 users. Work with users to troubleshoot system, model, and report issues
Source, manipulate, and upload data from several source systems using the BI and database ETL tools
The source systems include SAP ECC, SAP BW, PeopleSoft HR, PeopleSoft Financials, SharePoint, HFM, SQL Server, SalesForce, Essbase, Adaptive, Oracle, and several other financial and accounting systems
Write and maintain TM1 processes to archive data within existing cubes, transfer data to and from cubes, and import and export data to and from other source systems
Create, update, and publish standardized Excel reports using TM1 ActiveForms, TM1 Action Buttons, and complex VBA code
Automate and streamline existing processes
Write and maintain SQL queries, views, and stored procedures to source and consolidate relational data
Create and maintain SSIS packages and scheduled jobs to load data into SQL Server databases and provide routine system backups and maintenance
Implement and maintain TM1 security models using server, cube, dimension, element and cell-level security for financial and HR-related data
Maintain approval workflow for Capital Asset Requests in SharePoint
Coordinate and manage annual software license and user access reviews for TM1 and other ancillary systems
Write and maintain complex TM1 business rules to provide additional reporting and analysis capabilities
Write and maintain TM1 feeder rules to optimize system performance
Provide in person and remote training on new functionality and business models to the finance and accounting departments
Write and maintain detailed system documentation to explain business models, processes, and data flows
Manage master data for hierarchies and elements within TM1 cubes and dimensions and within the Master Data Services (MDS) system
Administer/upgrade servers and software for TM1 and ancillary system for both production and development environments
Act as the administrator for the TM1 SharePoint portal
Required skills: 
Bachelor of Science in Information Technology or Computer Science
MBA/MS a plus
5+ years experience in designing, building, and implementing business solutions using information technology
Prior experience in a systems support role
Business Intelligence experience with TM1 required
Database or SQL experience required
Familiar with reconciliation of Actuals, Forecasts, and Plans against various source systems
TM1 development/administrative experience required
Preferred skills: 
Cognos BI, Essbase, Analysis Services, or Hyperion experience
Multidimensional database experience
Demonstrated knowledge of financial statement analysis, income statement, balance sheet and cash flow
Application experience with: Microsoft SQL Server, SSIS, Master Data Services (MDS), SharePoint, SAP ECC, SAP BW (Business Analyzer), Excel
Programming language experience with: SQL, VBA, MDX
Strong problem solving abilities
Demonstrated ability to lead projects or handle large, complex processes
Great verbal and written communication skills
Interested candidates please send resume in Word format to Please reference job code 61312 when responding to this ad.

The ideal candidate will have prior experience developing reports in Cognos, will have involvement either in the finance industry or with a finance department, and will also have a business analyst mindset. They will be responsible for leading the design and support of enterprise-wide business intelligence applications and architecture including analyzing business needs and translating them into technology as well as process solutions/optimization. If you are passionate about analysis and developing business solution this role may be a fit for you! SENIOR BI ANALYST RESPONSIBILITIES:

Work with Finance stakeholders to understand business needs and develop business acumen.



Gather and analyze business requirements from stakeholders and, based on findings, design functional specifications for BI front-end applications. 



Serve as a thought leader and implementation strategist for BI systems that deliver meaningful and actionable information to key business personnel.



Work projects through to completion while keeping project team members, stakeholders, vendors and ITS management informed of issues and overall status. May coordinate small projects as well.



Identify inefficiencies and gaps (data integrity, scalability, security, performance, manageability, etc.) in current BI environment and recommend solutions.

Excellent knowledge of MS Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel.

General knowledge of or skills in coordinating projects providing scope definition, risk analysis, and status updates to appropriate parties, as well as leadership to the project team.



Attention to detail and accuracy.

Job Description: •    Experienced BI developer who will lead the work of a team of approximately 5 report developers to execute the strategic BI plan developed by the program and architect.•    This person will be responsible for design of a reporting system that supports rapid, reusable reporting components with row, column, dimension, and report level security controls.•    This role will be responsible for the production of a high -quality reporting that meets the business requirements. Must be able to interpret business requirements into functional stories. This role must be proficient in interacting with business users. •    This role will have a strong focus on user experience. details:
4 Corner Resources is assisting a client in filling an Business Intelligence Analyst role in the Tampa area. 

Purpose of the Position:
Responsible for providing analytics support across the organization to enable better data-driven decision making and planning by senior management. As a member of the Business Intelligence team will assist in:

Supporting key strategic decision making, process improvement and insight within the company.
Creating a unified and integrated view of our core data aligned with main institutional objectives.
Improving information accessibility and horizontal information sharing across the organization.
Establishing an enterprise-wide approach to data management.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities

Play key role in cross-functional reporting and analytics efforts across multiple Organizational units and key initiatives
Assemble and summarize data, make presentations of findings, and provide recommendations for to support senior management decision making.
Conduct trending, forecasting, predictive modeling to identify patterns and get to the root causes.
Identify reporting needs and create/improve daily, weekly and monthly reports.
Develop and maintain reports and metrics to track employee performance management.
Document and update existing standard operating procedures, process maps and org charts.
Standardize cross-departmental data definitions, KPIs, and calculations.
Share knowledge, expertise and best practices with new and existing analysts throughout the company.


Skills & Core Attributes Required:


Excellent written and verbal communication skills, specifically an ability to communicate effectively and persuasively with senior management
Enthusiasm for understanding and deriving actionable insights from data generated in a dynamic business environment.
Analytical thinker with proven ability to solve complex problems.


Interest in analyzing data to understand business needs, and recommend additional or improved ways of meeting business objectives.
Ability to integrate data from many sources (quantitative and qualitative) into one or more holistic views for senior management use.
Working proficiency in Excel or more advanced data management and manipulation tools
Desire to learn new things and drive operational outcomes.


Skills & Core Attributes Preferred:

Academic or professional experience in financial and/or operational modeling.
Academic or professional experience developing statistical models or forecasts in R, SAS, or SPSS.
Experience creating dashboards in Power BI, Qlik, or Tableau.
Exposure to ANSI/ISO standard SQL or major SQL dialect (e.g., PL/SQL, T-SQL, or PL/pgSQL).
Experience or interest in the Education or Education Management industries.

Education/Experience Required:

Minimum of Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Math, Accounting or Finance.
Minimum of 1-3 years of experience in business, process, and operations initiatives.

BI developer skilled at sourcing and blending data from multiple data

necessary KPIs. The development lead will work closely with the business teams
to learn about the existing business processes and associated technical
solutions, and produce robust data visualization products that optimize/enhance
existing business processes while keeping in line with broader IT strategies of

architect who analyzes the upstream data sources to blend various data sets,

reports/dashboards, testing, deployment, and maintenance in Microsoft Power BI.

Server, as well as Excel-based or SharePoint-based data sets. These data sets
are to be blended in Power BI data model and refreshed into Power BI service on
a periodic basis.

Job Title:    Tableau Business Intelligence Analyst
Location:    Richardson, TX                          
 
 
JOB SUMMARY 
 
The Business Intelligence Analyst position is responsible for developing and supporting the Work Force Analyst Department for our Social Media client reporting through use of all client systems and Microsoft Office applications.  This would include identifying, capturing and developing timely and accurate reporting of data, to provide one source, in a concise and actionable format, as well as deep dive analytics, to provide insights on trends and root cause analysis on performance metrics. This position requires a self-starter, working in a fast-paced environment that is capable of handling multiple priorities, with minimal direction, utilizing a Continuous Improvement methodology.
 
This is a key role that has opportunities for cross functional project leadership both internally within the customer service environment and externally with our client account. 
 
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
 

Prepares and executes daily, weekly and monthly reporting with accuracy, along with adhoc reporting required
Analyzes and interprets reporting results and trends to determine improvement opportunities

Excellent Tableau and MS EXCEL and skills

details:
Position Summary

The Business Intelligence Analyst reports to the Director of Business Intelligence and will use Alteryx to source, prep and blend data for use in Qlikview applications. This teammate will provide direct end user support for our Alteryx environment users and will be responsible for gathering requirements, designing and implementing enhancements for our Alteryx workflows. 


Essential Duties & Responsibilities: 


Act as Alteryx knowledge expert within the Business Intelligence team.

Provides direct end user support for our Alteryx & Qlik environment users.

Troubleshoots and drives successful resolutions of Alteryx environment issues.
Gathers and documents requirements for new Alteryx & Qlik initiatives. 
Creates and maintains automated workflows to prep, blend and export data with Alteryx
Accounts for the accuracy of the data presented to users through the execution of validation processes and testing procedures.
Maintains Alteryx environment and workflow documentation 
Assists with the development of complex ad hoc analyses
Learn market-leading business discovery platform, Qlikview





A successful candidate will possess the following skills and attributes



Ability to work in a fast-paced environment


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills


Effective communication skills


Ability to work independently as well as a part of a team


Detail oriented 


Fundamental Awareness of Business intelligence processes and technologies


Advanced level knowledge of designing and creating Alteryx workflows
Required Experience:





2 years of hands on experience in designing and creating Alteryx workflows


Gathering and documenting user requirements


Change and Release Management


Qlikview, Crystal Reports, Birst, Tableau, or Business Objects experience a plus


Hotel, Airline or Tour Industry experience a plus




Additional Requirements:

Candidate must be authorized to work in the US.
