title: Business Intelligence

details:
Continuum Health Alliance is developing a best-in-class Healthcare Platform to enable our clients to achieve the Triple Aim. This individual will work closely with Executive Leaders across multiple domains, including clinical operations, IT, & Analytics. The Senior Healthcare Analyst plays a key role as a conduit between the Informatics and Integrated Care Solutions (ICS) teams. In this capacity, the Senior Analyst ensures all key Informatics deliverables are being met, communicating report definitions to the internal PHM teams, and presenting reports and data to customers. This role needs to understand, prioritize, and plan key reporting and analytics customer needs; with the responsibility for meeting the analytic and reporting needs of internal and external clients. This individual will play a pivotal role in the designing and developing dashboards used in customer presentations of reports and drill-down in real time to share key findings. The position reports directly to the VP of Analytics and requires an analytic and end-to-end solution mindset as well as a hands-on approach to get the job done via applied critical thinking.


General:

Subject matter expert in healthcare data; including Clinical and Commercial & Medicare payor claims
Acts as a PHM Reporting subject matter expert and is responsible for educating internal and external customers on report and analysis understanding
Ability to analyze and understand healthcare related data files, data layouts and data dictionaries for the purpose of reporting and analysis; files include eligibility/roster, account/plan, medical claims, pharmacy claims, clinical extracts from EHR systems
Partnering with the IT Informatics team to coordinate the definition and delivery of client’s various analytics, reporting, and actuarial needs
Responsible for working with multiple cross-functional teams consisting of clinical, IT, sales and marketing, and administrative experts in support of implementations & informatics operations
Ad-hoc assignment and Project Management duties upon request


Analysis and Data Related Responsibilities:

Assist with implementation & design of data warehouse for reporting, analysis, & applications – internal & external
Analyzing key trends and performance related to clinical and network performance of programs, practices, and providers of health care; identify opportunities related to costs, utilization, and quality with the ability to report findings to senior leadership via a standard Executive Summary and supporting Conversational Analysis
Ability to analyze data & report findings to be used for strategy; presents analytic trends and recommendations with the ability to field questions with minimal support
Responsible for providing weekly status updates on (ICS) Key Performance Indicators as established by leadership
Data discovery and application of deep drill-down of data & understanding of epidemiology, with the ability to adapt to emerging healthcare trends in support of performance-based quantitative & qualitative measurement.
Develops key dashboards to be used in data discovery and analysis with internal and external customers.


 
Informatics and Project Management Responsibilities:

Serves as the liaison between the IT Informatics team and related IT functions and the Integrated Care Solutions team to ensure all customer-facing deliverables are being met (internal and external)
Works in conjunction with the Informatics team to create valid methodologies to measure and monitor program, practice and provider performance; items include the design of schemas/cubes, monitoring development and testing quality of output, and ensuring production needs and goals are met
Responsible for working with the Informatics to develop documentation for Standard Report Packages provided to internal and external customers
Supports in the design and development of the Enterprise Data Warehouse; specifically for healthcare related cost of care, utilization, and HEDIS/PQRS supported quality measurement and related data/measure dictionaries
Collaborates with IT and ICS teams to understand, document, and quality assure all required data elements used for reporting and analysis; execute test cases to validate source data has been accurately loaded, mapped, and transformed for accurate analytic and reporting purposes
Participates in customer/partner facing activities related to data to ensure a comprehensive understanding of data provided, data logic, and data use & limitations; ensures findings are communicated to key stakeholders for validation and sign-off as necessary
Develop and maintain knowledge of Continuum’s PHM platform, data warehouse design, data definitions, system capabilities, and data integrity issues.
Develop project plans as applicable and coordinate development of reporting and analytic initiatives


Required:

Bachelor’s Degree
A self-starter with 7+ years’ experience in a healthcare analytics role and an understanding of Value-Based Healthcare initiatives.
Ability to understand and interpret IT Reporting/Informatics output and communicate to internal/external customers.
Experience working with CMS and Commercial claims and clinical data
Demonstrable thought leadership with the ability to understand the big picture of clinical, technical, and analytical operations
Customer-centric focus with the drive to meet the client needs.
Team player with the ability to collaborate and communicate with diverse cross-functional teams
Advanced computer skills, specifically MS applications; experience using MS BI Stack, Excel, Access, SQL,
Content expertise in HEDIS, PQRS, and other quality performance standards
Willingness to support needs across teams to meet common goals
Professional and courteous manners and speaking style, both in person and telephonic.
Proven ability to divide personal perspectives from process management ensuring information based outcomes
Demonstrated experience directly serving physician executives
Ability to respond promptly problem-solving requests and pursuing self-directed analysis


Preferred:

Knowledge of the healthcare industry and healthcare experience working with medical claims and big data elements
Strong written and verbal communications skills to present findings and recommendations
Detail oriented, strong problem-solving skills, and data quality assurance acumen


Performance Standards/ Code of Conduct
Each employee accepts responsibility for accountability, compassion, communication, etiquette, privacy, teamwork, and safety.
Performance Standards – Each member of the team plays an important role in providing consistent service to all customers: patients, visitors, employees, physicians, and others with whom we interact. These Performance Standards and behaviors define what is expected of you as an employee and what you can expect from others. 
Accountability – Accepts Responsibility for all aspects of performance and actions.
Compassion – Is sensitive to and displays empathy for the needs of our customers.
Communication – Uses appropriate interpersonal skills, styles, and techniques to keep customers
informed, and provides necessary information.
Confidentiality – Maintains strict patient confidentiality in compliance with HIPAA at all times.
Etiquette – Demonstrates courteous, polite, friendly and cooperative behavior towards others.
Privacy – Creates and maintains a trusting relationship with every patient.
Teamwork – Demonstrates the ability to work well with others.
Safety – Creates and maintains a safe working environment.

Optomi, in partnership with a Global Investment company in the Baltimore, MD area supporting over 800 billion dollars in assets is seeking, a Business Analyst that will put an emphasis on requirements gathering and bridging communications between the financial services and technology groups. 



The Business Analyst will be responsible for communicating with key system users and the other teams to translate business needs into project requirements. They will need a solid understanding of end-to-end business process, ability to learn financial services if they don’t have the experience, and utilize project tools so they can track the progress.

Be a part of an organization that is implementing Agile methodologies and SAFe implementations.
Fast growing company with the opportunity to pave your career path within the organization.

Have the opportunity to work with other top fortune 100 companies and a large integration between two companies.

5+ years of experience interpreting customer and internal business needs and translate them into requirements.

details:
Python Developer 
 
Job #: 305256
 
The pay rate is in the $70 to $80/hour range per w-2 or $80 - $90/hr. for an independent corp.  We are not able to work with Third Parties for this position. This project is a 9-month + contract position.  The location is New York, NY (Manhattan - Midtown area).   The interview process is a phone and a face to face interview.  We are seeking local candidates only for this position. 
 
Job Description:
Our client, a leader in their industry, as excellent opportunity available for Python Developer to work on a 9-month contract position in New York, NY.  This consultant will be responsible for providing backend Python development to create automated data quality control software.  You will develop software and APIs to intake, manipulate, and streamline data sets for a DW/BI platform to support revenue analytics business initiatives.   
 
Key Responsibilities:
•    Write Python software to automate data quality control
•    Utilize vendor APIs to build automated checks for the in-house data warehouse datasets 
•    Build processes to identify data misclassifications
•    Become a subject matter expert on our clients’ data pipeline
•    Perform periodic data audits to identify vendor gaps and garbage data, as well as provide recommendations on improvements
•    Build release management software to perform automated regression testing

Must Have Skills and Experience:
•    3-5 years of development experience in Python (backend and API development)
•    Strong understanding of  dataset manipulation, JSON file formats, as well as other industry standards
•    Extensive experience utilizing APIs and building automated processes
•    Experience pulling data using SQL statements
•    Solid Linux or Unix experience
•    Educational background in software development, engineering, or an equivalent quantitative field
 
Preferred Skills:
•    Experience building Quality control software products and processes
•    Prior experience with Looker, AWS, Presto, or Qubole is a plus
•    Prior experience and understanding of media business a plus
 
As a w-2 contract employee of Eliassen Group, you are eligible for our benefit plan that includes medical, dental, vision, life and prescription drug coverage through Blue Cross Blue Shield. We also offer a 401(k) plan with matching, direct deposit, and a referral bonus plan.  
 
Please send your MS Word resume to [Click Here to Email Your Resumé] for immediate consideration.  
 
Also, please connect with me on LinkedIn at www.linkedin.com/in/bencrosby/
 
Direct w-2 or independent corps only – No 3rd Parties – Position not eligible for Visa Sponsorship

details:
Our client, one of the world's leading luxury fashion companies, is seeking a driven Freelance Marketing Coordinator for their Fashion and Beauty Division. Founded on excellence the Company now offers a wide range of high quality products manufactured with the greatest attention to detail. Their Men's, Women's Apparel and Accessories lines are sold in high end department, ecommerce and specialty stores nationwide.Position Overview: The Freelance Marketing Coordinator will be assisting in the development and execution of the Beauty and Fashion programs relevant to the U.S. marketplace, including new launches and ongoing promotional support. The ideal candidate will have a blend of analytical/strategic and creative/problem solving skills and have a passion for the Beauty/Fashion and Luxury Brand.  Responsibilities of the Freelance Marketing Coordinator: CATEGORY/BRAND MANAGEMENT 
Assist in the development and execution of product launches and animations
Manage paperwork, timetables and coordination of deliverables
Review copy, artwork, training documents, etc. for accuracy
Coordinate and manage calendar updates (marketing, team, global, 3-year)
Assist in updating on-going team documents
Help coordinate the execution of marketing plan through daily interface with key support groups: Forecasting, Planning, Marketing Services, Finance, Creative, Education, Sales, Events, Digital, PR, etc.
Pull and analyze post-launch data and generate detailed launch performance summaries
BUSINESS ANALYSIS
Perform on-going analysis of the Women's fragrance business, and conduct ad-hoc queries as necessary to answer business questions
Perform market trend and competitive environment analyses
Track and analyze competitive SOM and activity
Conduct bi-annual pricing analysis
Track and document new competitive launches 
BUDGET MANAGEMENTResponsible for tracking of all invoices and feeds discrepancies to Manager; support in the tracking of all budgetsMEETING PREPARATION & TEAM SUPPORT
Help to prepare National Sales Meetings and Retailer presentations
Various other ad-hoc requests
Qualifications for the Freelance Marketing Coordinator: 
Strong analytical skills; ability to think strategically
Capability to think strategically yet execute in minutia
Extremely detailed oriented
Strong organizational skills and follow-up; ability to prioritize and multi-task
Ability to adapt and shift priorities quickly
Extremely resourceful and adept at problem solving
Exceptional oral and written communication skills, including presentation and interpersonal skills
Expert level Excel and PowerPoint skills
Must demonstrate initiative and ability to work independently
Previous experience in a fast-paced environment
Proven track record in current position
Passion and enthusiasm for data and using metrics to drive strategy
Must be proactive with strong work ethic
Team player; willing to help out the team, even if outside of current job scope
Overall, dynamic, inquisitive and entrepreneurial thinking
Passion for beauty and Chanel, insatiable curiosity and desire to learn

2-4 years in related industry / marketing role OR
Bachelor's and Degree

The Role:
Designing, developing, and maintaining large scale SQL Server Database structures
Designing, developing, and maintaining T-SQL code
Designing, developing, and maintaining Business Intelligence packages
SSIS Project Deployment Preference
Designing, developing, and maintaining SQL Reporting
SSRS Preference
Designing, developing, and maintaining Production trouble-shooting scripts for other internal groups
Designing, developing, and maintaining automation and deployment tools for the Operational DBAs
Powershell Preference
Creation and maintenance of Database servers within Development Environment
Work with other internal groups, 3rd party groups, and external customers to design needed solutions
Provide support to QC (Quality Control) and Operational DBAs on releases of code

Excellent organizational and communication skills

details:
JOB SUMMARY:


Performs design, testing, implementation, maintenance, support and training for SharePoint and web applications.  Troubleshoots and performs root cause analysis of identified systems' defects.  Leads requirement gathering sessions with business and technical groups.  Researches and proposes solutions for site defects, enhancements, and new product solutions.  Creates/updates required functional and technical documentation.  Develops SharePoint solutions in accordance with departmental standards.  Conducts unit and integration testing for all developed/modified websites and web applications.  Performs and participates in design and code reviews.  Provides ongoing maintenance support for SharePoint Farms, Site Collections, Subsites, Workflows, and Web Applications.  Drives efficiencies through optimization and automation.  Applies expertise in SharePoint design for complex solutions.  Recommends the redesign of sites and Site Collections.  Generates technical designs according to documented business needs and participates in design reviews.  Designs and implements SharePoint Farms and security.  Serves as Subject Matter Expert in two or more business domains.  Performs the role of Project Manager or serves as IT representative on company and intra-organizational projects.  Coordinates and/or communicates with other organizations for joint efforts.  Develops, teaches and helps enforce proper site standards and organization methodologies.  Prepares and delivers site presentations to management and end-users.  Provides farm architecture guidance and team mentorship.  Plans, schedules and directs in-house developed and/or 3rd party system implementations. 


ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:


Researches and gathers data about existing methodology, problem areas, desired features and enhancements and new system objectives.  Designs, develops and tests websites and database solutions.  Provides technical support, troubleshooting and problem resolution for production SharePoint sites and web applications, including on-call availability.  Provides on-going maintenance support for specifically assigned systems including, but not limited to, upgrading to new releases and installation of patches.  Plans, schedules and provides operational procedures and directs system implementation.  Gathers and analyzes requirements producing functional and technical specifications.  Assists in the development of requests for proposals.  Evaluates, tests, implements, maintains, supports and trains end-users for SharePoint sites.  Works on various project teams as IT representative or project leader as needed.  Applies judgment in devising program logic and selecting and adapting standard programming procedures.  Participates in training, seminars and professional meetings to improve technical skills and develop further knowledge.  Creates and maintains all required document artifacts (functional, technical and user).  Leads and participates in MSD Project Management process and Change Management Process.  Investigates and analyzes feasibility of program requirements and develops programming specifications.  Responsible for coordinating and monitoring the work of external consultants.  Functions as an IT representative with business and external groups.  Mentors junior team members.



KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES NECESSARY TO THE WORK:
Knowledge of relational databases (Oracle, SQL Server); knowledge of Microsoft Office and its integration capabilities with SharePoint; knowledge of SharePoint Server, SharePoint Online, Project Server and SharePoint Designer; knowledge of Microsoft SharePoint Architecture; knowledge and understanding of one or more infrastructure technologies such as database, network, security, server, storage, and workstations; skill in configuring enterprise level SharePoint search, Business Intelligence, PerformancePoint and PowerPivot service applications; skill in managing content databases, site quotas and limits; skill in PowerShell scripting; skill in applying security roles within SharePoint; skill in analyzing, designing, installing and configuring SharePoint environments; skill in operating a PC and associated Windows software (e.g. Microsoft Office Suite, etc.); skill in oral and written communication; ability to adapt to changing work environment; ability to exercise judgment and discretion; ability to work in a team environment; ability to resolve problems; ability to maintain confidential information; ability to work under heavy surges in workload and deadline pressure; ability to perform feasibility studies and system analysis; ability to train end-users.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Bachelor Degree in Computer Science or a related field; ten or more years of related experience; an equivalent combination of education and experience may be substituted.  Must possess a valid driver's license.  Must have safe work and driving habits.

details: This is an exciting opportunity for a SQL Database Developer to join an innovative, established, well respected software company.  They foster a fast-paced, fun, and challenging work environment surrounded by passionate and talented team members as well as some of the most respected industry experts.  Their culture values strong technical, creative minded individuals. This position is a full time, permanent and offers a very competitive base salary plus bonus potential and terrific benefits.  Candidates must be able to work on a full time permanent basis (W2) without sponsorship of any sort.  C2C is not an option.   Position Summary: We are looking for a highly motivated, experienced SQL Developer who will be responsible for developing applications and integrations using the Microsoft SQL Server platform. This will include reports, data exports and other data-related assignments. The position will work with our developers to provide data services for existing and new modules/functions and provide ongoing database support for systems. This individual will also perform data analysis, assess data quality, perform data cleanup and develop benchmarks and reporting. This position requires a strong blend of communication and technical skills.There is enormous opportunity to develop exciting new capabilities that will key the growth of the company. Leveraging your passion and data expertise, you will be a member of the team that is transforming the organization.Duties: - Design and development of MS SQL Server database objects and procedural code supporting various custom and 3rd party applications, including writing Stored Procedures, Functions, Triggers- Optimize and tune MS SQL databases and queries and perform database normalization- Work with application developers to provide data services for existing and new applications- Maintain developed source code in the repository for all databases and keep all build programs up to date- Assess and maintain data integrity- Support and troubleshoot application issues and document solutions- Assist developers with complex query tuning and schema refinement.- Provide 24x7 support for critical production systems.- Perform scheduled maintenance and support release deployment activities after hours.- Share domain and technical expertise, providing technical mentorship and cross-training to other peers and team members. Required experience:   - Extensive experience in database design including referential integrity, with strong understanding of key data elements, table indexing and database tuning and data architecture- Extensive experience developing highly tuned T-SQL Stored Procedures for web front-end applications- Strong MS SQL Server Enterprise Edition Administration experience required - Enterprise experience developing and maintaining SQL Server 2014 (experience with SQL - Server Strong understanding of Microsoft SQL Server Tools including SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS), SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)- Ability to solve complex problems, strong analytical skills and the ability to trace issues to the root source- Degree in Computer Science or a related field a plus Preferred experience: - NoSQL knowledge- RavenDB or similar JSON based database- Data Warehousing and BI platforms- Working in a hosted environment- SaaS experience

Overview
The Marketing Data Analyst role is responsible for the execution of all reporting needs for a rapidly growing marketing team. As a Marketing Data Analyst, you will work closely with both internal marketing team members along with members of other departments to develop and analyze metrics that will be used to hit performance targets for a multimillion dollar annual marketing budget.  This is a high impact, data driven role in which analysis will drive company decisions.

details:
The Sr. Data Analytics Engineer is responsible for leading the successful delivery of business intelligence information to the entire organization. The Sr. Data Analytics Engineer is experienced in BI development and implementation, data architecture, ETL layers, performance tuning and data delivery and interpretation. Emphasizing effective collaboration with key stakeholders, the Sr. Data Analytics Engineer is responsible for the assessment of business requirements, collection and identification of technical specifications, and the subsequent development of technology solutions. The Sr. Data Analytics Engineer works to develop an integrated view of the BI team using a repeatable approach, cohesive framework, and industry standards with an emphasis on MicroStrategy and Pentaho Data Integration as core development tools. The Sr. Data Analytics Engineer has deep theoretical and practical knowledge of the Systems Development Life Cycle (SDLC) activities specific to data integration and analytics. The Sr. Data Analytics Engineer is expected to apply independent judgement and initiative in carrying out assigned tasks and will function as a lead and mentor to a team of developers. In addition, the Sr. Data Analytics Engineer works collaboratively with other analysis and development teams to create standards and best practices for BI solutions.  Essential Job Duties:

Provide level 3 support for production systems

details:
Treasury Business Analyst, who can support key business initiatives with insight derived from data for our Treasury Department. This person will be responsible for automating the generation of various internal reports for use by Treasury operations staff. Reporting to be automated will be for purposes including, but not limited to, daily positioning of domestic and international cash balances, cash forecasts, automation of transaction approval processes, daily reporting and analytics.
The Business Analyst will be required to work with the process owners and other internal teams to:


Develop automated approaches to pulling data from existing sources such as daily bank files, propriety coin inventory systems, data cubes, SQL Server-based BI environments, and the company’s ERP (SAP), Cash Receipts, Payment Register, FX, Banking, Banking Feeds both inbound and outbound (Citibank)), Finance and Controllership,  Auditing (Internal IT, SOX, External – Deloitte).

Automate the calculations on that data and population of results in reports for use by Treasury and other finance staff,
Educate Treasury staff on the automation tools employed for the above purposes so they may sustain the newly-automated environment independently going forward


Key Responsibilities:

Elicit requirements using interviews, business process descriptions, business analysis, task and workflow analysis
Responsible for elevating the efficiency and effectiveness of the processes that exist within Treasury; offering recommendations on how best to construct these processes in order automate many daily tasks
Lead process redesign initiatives; solutions developed & implemented should be innovative, thorough, practical, and sustainable.
Build critical tools and automate processes for efficiency
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs
user friendly automated solutions
Utilize your experience in using enterprise-wide requirements definition and management systems and methodologies required
Strong analytical and product management skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret business needs and translate them into application and operational solutions.

Education & Experience:

3+ years related experience

Experience with Treasury Functions. Cash Receipts, Payment Register, FX, Banking, Banking Feeds both inbound and outbound (Citibank)), Finance and Controllership,  Auditing (Internal IT, SOX, External – Deloitte).

Experience with relational databases and data modeling
Experience with software development lifecycles, including agile software development
Experience with SQL strongly preferred
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Must be able to communicate effectively and confidently with users, team members and management
Organized and detail-oriented
Proven experience at driving consensus across multiple stakeholders


Strong facilitation skills. Must be able to elicit requirements from various personalities across organizational and geographical boundaries
Experience applying these skills and abilities to finance, accounting, or treasury functions is highly desired.

details:
This position is a Capital Markets Analyst on the Operations Risk and Control Team, supporting Regulatory Risk for securities operations. This individual will work closely with Compliance and Regulatory Relations of the company to develop working relationships and represent operational processes, improvements, and impact. The individual will also partner with Legal, Audit, Business Management, Project Management, Finance, Technology, and others to connect Operations to the organization’s goals and provide feedback on impact to Operations from those changes. The candidate will need to provide clear directions to Operations on current and upcoming regulations. The candidate will use industry and regulatory knowledge to guide Operations through its industry implementation committees, steering committees, and implementation groups on behalf of Wells Fargo based on feedback from Operations partners, and disseminate clear information back to operations from these groups.

Desired Skills: • Extensive knowledge and understanding of loan, securities, and derivative products • Intermediate Microsoft Office skills • Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills • Effective organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritizing skills • Ability to work in a fast-paced deadline driven environment • FINRA registration including Series 99 or 7 (or FINRA recognized equivalents) Other Desired Qualifications • A BS/BA degree or higher in accounting, finance, or economics. • 10+ years’ experience in the financial services industry, at least 7 of which should be in Operations or functions such as Compliance or Operational Risk supporting Operations • Thorough understanding of regulations as they apply to a Swap Dealer Broker-Dealer, Prime Broker, and/or FCM from an Operations perspective. This includes CFTC, SEC, FINRA, MSRB and SRO rules and regulations. • Thorough understanding of Derivatives, Fixed Income, Equities, and Debt Securities is mandatory. • Detailed knowledge of regulations affecting a Swap Dealer, Broker Dealer, Prime Broker, or FCM from and international (Non-US) perspective. • Participation in audits impacting the Operations division of a 'globally systemically important bank'. • Experience partnering with Operations to properly implement regulatory changes and providing guidance to Operations for seamless compliance. • Experience challenging the status quo while maintaining relationships with business partners. • Experience with large-scale implementations impacting multiple asset-classes and divisions. • Strong candidates will possess superior ability to organize verbal and written communication to clarify purpose and importance, stress major points, and follow a logical sequence. • Candidates are proficient with business concepts, including operations risk and controls, meticulous with detail and capable of independently suggesting controls or improvements. • Candidates should be able to work effectively in a demanding, fast-paced, dynamic environment, handling multiple tasks and projects concurrently, while maintaining the highest standard of excellence

details:
Position Description:
Support Brazeway’s enterprise applications including the ERP System, Microsoft Dynamics AX 2009.  Apply standard programming procedures and knowledge of pertinent functional areas.  Analyze needs, design, write, and test new programs and applications.  Maintain existing systems and provide technical assistance to users as well as to others in IT department.  Work according to approved requirements and detailed specifications to refine and improve business processes and systems. Apply judgment in devising program logic and selecting and adapting standard programming procedures.  Obtain input and direction from senior members of application development team.
Responsibilities:

Analyze requirements, procedures and problems to either automate processing or modify existing enterprise systems using object oriented programming, testing, and debugging to implement improvements.
Work with the business analysts and enterprise application user base to identify gaps between business processes and system functionality and design methods to bridge the gap.
Document all aspects of system design, develop, and test new and modified computer programs by applying knowledge of programming techniques and computer systems.
Understand existing information processing systems to evaluate effectiveness and develop new systems to improve production and workflow of business processes.
Ensure data security and integrity
Review user requirements and performs analysis, design, implementation and installation related to new software developed and/or acquired
Take ownership of the projects and tasks assigned and ensure deliverables meet or exceed functional, technical, and performance requirements
Collaborate with applications and infrastructure teams and submit for code review and approval for all software modifications. 
Perform simultaneous activities in support of Information Technology department's projects and priorities
Provide post implementation production support including problem triage, analysis, and resolution
Provides on-call support as assigned
Actively supports and manages to our Process Based Leadership program, 10 Commitments & 8 People Principles.


Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science
3+ Years of application development experience
Knowledge/Experience in SQL Server, SSRS, SSAS, SSIS, etc.
Key Skills required: C#, C++, .NET, ASP, XML, HTML, CSS, Javascript, T-SQL, MS Visual Studio, SharePoint
Previous experience using ERP system, preferably in a manufacturing environment.  Microsoft Dynamics AX a plus with knowledge of X++
Experience in using business intelligence and analytics tools such as MS PowerBI or Tableau a plus
Excellent analytical & problem solving skills
Work well within a team environment
Strong ability to communicate effectively with all end users, team members, project leaders, etc.
Ability to travel to multiple facilities in the U.S. and Mexico up to 10%
Bi-lingual (Spanish) skills a plus

Compensation/Benefits:
Salary is commensurate with qualifications and experience. Benefits include: 401(k), bonus program, profit sharing plan, life insurance, disability insurance, health & dental insurance, paid vacation. Brazeway is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Culture:
We push ourselves every day to ‘obsolete everything we do’ in an effort to continuously improve upon the innovations and breakthroughs we have introduced throughout our history. Our best designs and most impactful innovations are developed in an environment where no idea is too far-fetched, no effort is wasted and no vision is too far off. The outcome from this approach has propelled us to the forefront of ingenuity for all of the sectors we serve, and the Brazeway name has become synonymous with transformation. www.brazeway.com

details:
Are you just looking for a job or are you looking for challenge and reward? We have an opening for a Business Analytics Consultant that loves rolling up their sleeves and making it happen. This position isn't for everyone but we aren't looking for everyone we are looking for Top Talent!
Are you analytical? Do you like solving things? Do you like new challenges? Do you have strong communication skills?
Our senior consultant works in a project oriented environment in the electric utility industry whose assignment on a client engagement is typically to create, implement, and improve the business processes and technology our clients use to run and operate their business. Many of our projects have a finance and accounting focus. Our engagements have an agreed upon (contracted/negotiated) set of project deliverables, timeline, and fee arrangement. Projects vary in nature, size and complexity, running from a few weeks to multiple years in duration. Projects are performed on the client premises and can either be performed as an individual serving the client or as a team of consultants meeting the needs of the client. All projects require senior consultants to have access and utilize proprietary, confidential, strategic and sensitive information of both the client and the employer. That information includes both physical and intellectual property. All assignments require that an employee maintain confidentiality and professional standards set by our clients and agreed to through our project contracts.Senior consultant assignments vary depending the nature of the client’s needs and usually require an individual to work across all functional business areas of a utility including generation, transmission, distribution, power procurement, customer service, accounting and finance, information technology, regulatory affairs, procurement and warehousing and other organizational areas at our clients. Senior Consultants are also required to understand the clients’ business challenges, create approaches to solve the challenges, and implement solutions agreed to with the clients. Senior Consultants obtain information, assimilate information, identify alternative solutions, provide recommended solutions and work with clients to determine the best options for their business needs. They are also expected to conduct interviews and meet with clients at all levels of an organization, including staff, managers, executives and officers. Senior Consultants are also expected to manage and supervise other consultants on projects. The level of supervision will vary with the complexity and difficulty of the assignment. Senior Consultants may be assigned projects in which they have little or no prior experience or expertise.Essential Job Functions• Ability to plan and execute a consulting projecto Understand a clients’ challenges, their needs and expectationso Develop work plans that define a project approach, deliverable, timeline, and fee arrangemento Execute the work plan agreed to with the cliento Lead a team in executing the work plan agreed to with the cliento Manage the tasks to be executed in the work plan• Research and gather data associated with business processes to develop designs• Interview clients from working levels through management levels to obtain additional information, address issues and develop potential recommendations that utilize technology• Reviewing documents describing current policies, processes and procedures to identify information applicable for use in analysis• Analyzing data from disparate systems and sources including identifying data linkages and manipulating large and complex data files• Building analytical models that can be reviewed, evaluated and modified within a reasonable amount of time and effort• Documenting processes, procedures and controls that accurately describe current state• Identifying areas for improvement in current business processes, procedures and controls• Determining potential alternatives to address process, procedure and control improvements• Implementing recommendations working cohesively with clients to obtain agreed upon business benefits and improvements• Effectively and concisely communicating results and deliverables via verbal and written communications• Developing final reports and executive summaries of deliverablesSkills and Specifications• Highly proficient with Microsoft Office products, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access and Outlook • Provides consistent, reliable delivery of high quality work products• Self-motivated and disciplined individual • Strong interpersonal skills; ability to get along well with a wide range of professionals • Must be an excellent communicator, including strong oral and written skills• High attention to detail• Strong critical thinking, analytical and problem solving skills• Ability to handle tight and/or unpredictable deadlines and constant changes • Ability to consistently make decisions with good judgment without supervision• Ability to calmly address concerns from an upset client both verbally and in writing without becoming agitated or escalating the situation• Ability to follow ethical and professional standards • Ability to learn new concepts quickly• Enthusiastic and pro-active professional • Ability to follow ethical and professional standards • Willingness to work long hours and weekends, when necessary• Ability to drive to client sites throughout Southern California, including but not limited to Los Angeles, Orange, Ventura, Santa Barbara, Riverside, San Bernardino and San Diego counties• Ability to travel to client sites anywhere in the United States primarily Phoenix and San Francisco and work away from home for long periods of time returning home only on weekends depending on the project.• Ability to work in new environments and unfamiliar work locations• Bachelor’s degree in a related field
Competitive salary plus bonus! Competitive benefits!
THIS POSITION IS NOT ELIGIBLE TO SPONSOR!

Highly proficient with Microsoft Office products, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access and Outlook • Provides consistent, reliable delivery of high quality work products• Self-motivated and disciplined individual • Strong interpersonal skills; ability to get along well with a wide range of professionals • Must be an excellent communicator, including strong oral and written skills• High attention to detail• Strong critical thinking, analytical and problem solving skills• Ability to handle tight and/or unpredictable deadlines and constant changes • Ability to consistently make decisions with good judgment without supervision• Ability to calmly address concerns from an upset client both verbally and in writing without becoming agitated or escalating the situation• Ability to follow ethical and professional standards • Ability to learn new concepts quickly• Enthusiastic and pro-active professional • Ability to follow ethical and professional standards • Willingness to work long hours and weekends, when necessary• Ability to drive to client sites throughout Southern California, including but not limited to Los Angeles, Orange, Ventura, Santa Barbara, Riverside, San Bernardino and San Diego counties• Ability to travel to client sites anywhere in the United States primarily Phoenix and San Francisco and work away from home for long periods of time returning home only on weekends depending on the project.• Ability to work in new environments and unfamiliar work locations• Bachelor’s degree in a related field

details:
ANALYTICAL ENGINEER (FEA) – Saginaw, MI Our client in Saginaw, MI, a highly reputable automotive parts supplier, is currently seeking an Analytical Engineer to join their staff.  In this role, this individual will be responsible to model and analyze new and existing products using virtual and experimental tools to provide both internal and external customers with the data necessary to produce products that satisfy the final customer’s requirements. DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:
 Participate in and contribute to component and system design processes from concept to production by analyzing, designing, and recommending methods to optimize products using finite element analysis & multi-body dynamics software, other engineering software, and experimental and analytical methods while interfacing with designers, project and manufacturing engineers, and customers.
 Create CAE reports for internal and external distribution
 Improve correlation between CAE and test results by incorporating experimental testing and new analytical methods
 Research, evaluate, and implement new ideas, methods, CAE software, hardware, and new technology to support the organization’s goals.

 REQUIRED EDUCATION, SKILLS & EXPERIENCE:
 
Bachelor’s degree in an engineering field, preferably Mechanical Engineering

 Additional training in a simulation discipline like finite element analysis (FEA)

 A minimum of 1 year of product design, development, or analysis experience.  Automotive drivetrain experience is preferred.
 
Strong analytical background with experience using CAE tools including finite element analysis, multi-body dynamics, and/or computational fluid dynamics.  Abaqus and Virtual Lab Motion are preferred.
 Experience with solid modeling (NX, Catia, Creo, SolidWorks, etc.) and product lifecycle management (PLM).  PTC Windchill PLM is preferred.
 Experience with experimental mechanicals including material and component testing, ASTM standards, strain gaging, modal analysis, and data acquisition.
 Experience with one or more programming languages including .NET, Python, Matlab, Mathcad, or equivalent engineering codes is desired.
 Familiarity with GD&T, tolerance stacks, tolerance analysis software, Six Sigma, SPC (statistical process control), manufacturing of powdered metal components, and design of experiments (DOE).

 Our client offers tremendous opportunity, competitive pay & outstanding benefits (including 401K, ESOP participation, and more). Our client will also provide relocation assistance for out-of-area candidates.  Qualified & interested parties are encouraged to apply today!
Why Kelly®?

industry leading organizations. Top companies throughout the world have trusted Kelly as a premier
source of engineering talent and services since 1965. And engineering job seekers know Kelly as a firm
with an unmatched reputation for quality, integrity and professionalism. Whether you seek the variety
and flexibility of working on short term project engagements, or prefer contract-to-hire or direct
hire placement with our clients, apply with Kelly to explore opportunities that suit your specific
professional interests.

As a workforce advocate for over 70 years, we are proud to directly employ nearly 500,000 people around the world and have a role in connecting thousands more with work through our global network of talent suppliers and partners. details:
BASIC PURPOSE
Assist the Accounting division and the Enterprise Data Warehouse application owner with data driven activities that affect Accounting reporting, processes, internal controls and business plans as well as Bank-wide data governance activities. Streamline, automate, and support financial data reports, processes, and analytics.     
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES 

Work collaboratively with department management, enterprise architecture and team members in defining, designing, and implementing reporting and business solutions to improve overall departmental business functions.
Build an understanding of the business environment at a level of detail that enables them to analyze reporting and processes in order to make recommendations to management to enhance and improve the department. Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Provide data solutions that are accurate, congruent and reliable, and ensure the information is easily accessible to users for direct consumption or integration with other systems.
Lead and facilitate special projects and data governance tasks that require cross-functional engagement with key staff across the Bank, including members of the data governance sub-committee, the business project teams, IT and external stakeholders, as appropriate.
Educate and train team members to use data as an analytical tool, displaying the information in new, more useful and informative forms for the purpose of process improvement and deeper analysis.
Maintain and expand industry, product, and functional knowledge relevant and beneficial to the Accounting operational excellence vision.
Assist and provide backup for other operational functions within Accounting Systems.
Perform additional responsibilities as assigned.

Job Requirements

Bachelors degree in Accounting, Finance, Computer Science, or related field is required.
3+ years of relevant experience in accounting/financial report development, business analytics, business intelligence or comparable role in a financial institutio
Excellent verbal and written communications skills as well as the ability to present, listen and accept instruction.
Ability to facilitate information and requirements gathering sessions, write and troubleshoot new and existing SQL queries working with a star-schema data warehouse. Advanced experience working with SQL query language, SSRS report builder, PowerPivot, PowerQuery, PowerView, PowerMap, PowerBI, or Tableau highly preferred.
Ability to break down ideas/issues leading to solutions as well as conduct research to uncover answers and provide solutions.
Organized and highly detail oriented.
Self-directed, yet strong orientation to be successful in groups and on teams.

details: Job Description    If you are an experienced BI/Analytics Developer looking for a position with a leading company, Bartech can help! We are a leading staffing firm and our clients include some over the nation’s biggest companies. Our client has a need for a BI/Analytics Developer. This is a contract position; however it is not uncommon for assignments to transition into permanent positions with our client companies. If you have the background we are looking for, and you are interested in an opportunity to get your foot in the door with leading company, we want to talk with you!     BI/Analytics Developer         Job Responsibilities Your specific duties as a BI/Analytics Developer will include:  This role is part of the Reporting and Analytics Enablement team within IM. The primary responsibility will be to create/develop BI and Analytic reports, visualizations and dashboards requested by various client departments using any one of a number of tools including Tableau, Qlik, Cognos, SAS and others as needed. Other duties can include data analysis, requirements definition, solution design consulting, report design, application development, framework modeling, and some testing.    BI/Analytics Developer Job Requirements As a BI/Analytics Developer you must represent our company well by being responsible, punctual and motivated to go above and beyond the call of duty. You must also be highly detail-oriented and organized with excellent analytic and problem-solving abilities. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.  Minimum 5 years of development experience with multiple BI and analytic tools, including but not limited to Tableau, Qlik, Cognos and/or SAS with an emphasis on the creation of visualizations, dashboards, and interactive reports. Demonstrated experience with big data tools including Hadoop, pig, hive, spark, impala, Cassandra, etc. Strong UI/UX skills and strong grasp of visualization design principles required. Strong data skills including analysis, framework modeling, performance optimization. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, are required. Strong work ethic and team work skills are required. Strong MS Office skills, specifically, visio, excel, ppt, PowerBI and SharePoint. Self-started mentality with the ability to work independently on deliverables when necessary. Ability to proactively anticipate needs, identify and recommend alternative solutions or options. Willingness to learn new tools and skills quickly. Natural curiosity and strong desire to solve problems quickly. Ability to quickly come up-to-speed in a new environment and/or industry Exposure to Python, R or R studio a plus. Strong math and statistical background a plus. Experience with big data platforms, including cloud based, on-prem or hybrid a plus; could include AWS, Cloudera, Hortonworks, Azure, etc.     BI/Analytics Developer  As a BI/Analytics Developer with Bartech, you will be working through an established and respected staffing organization with 40 years of serving as a trusted partner to our client companies. We are dedicated to providing our talent with personal, responsive attention, and will assign an employee care representative to answer any questions or concerns that you might have. Depending upon the client, the assignment and your performance, you can find potential opportunities for direct employment. Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with competitive compensation, including benefits. Available benefits for BI/Analytics Developer Position may include (but are not limited to):  Exceptional medical, dental, and vision 401(k) Paid time off, including holidays                                                     Make the most of your experience! Apply now!  Applicant must be eligible to work in the US for immediate opening. Keywords:

details:
Ref ID: 02380-0010399503Classification: Business AnalystCompensation: DOEExciting Opportunity!!! Robert Half Technology is currently seeking a experienced Business Intelligence Engineer. Business intelligence engineers must be data experts, as they work primarily with databases and different types of software. Often abbreviated as BI engineer, this job involves developing and fine tuning IT solutions. That can include anything from coding to testing to debugging to designing to implementing newly developed tools. A BI engineer spends a lot of time researching and planning solutions for existing problems within the company. BI engineers also are responsible for building OLAP, or online analytical processing. They also work with databases, both relational and multidimensional. BI engineers are often responsible for managing others in the IT department or in the company. Most BI engineer positions require a degree in computer science or programming and a substantial amount of work experience. As the primary focus of this position is to solve problems, BI engineers must always been mining data and presenting it in an understandable way. They should be capable of creating tables and writing reports on their findings, and they often simplify highly technical language for others in the company. Years Experience: 5-10. Experience: Relies on extensive experience to plan and accomplish tasks. Leadership/Contributions: Leads and directs the work of others.

details:
Position: Sr. BI Product Owner
Location: Alpharetta, GA
Duration: Direct Hire, Perm

Our client is a leading innovator in the contact center industry, and their mission is to solve the real-time challenges facing contact centers. A long and growing list of enterprise centers use their SaaS platform to automate a wide range of intraday management processes. The platform and community continue to grow, as their customers continue to find value like significant cost reduction, employee performance and engagement improvements, and omni-channel service delivery benefits.

Synergis is seeking a Product Manager (BI). As the Business Intelligence Product Manager, you will be responsible for our client's strategy, roadmap and implementation of Business Intelligence and Reporting solutions. The successful candidate will have demonstrated full lifecycle product management experience bringing Business Intelligence, Analytics or related solutions to market. In this role, you will collaborate closely with customers, operations, engineering and services to understand business needs, identify solutions, and develop and execute on roadmaps. You will be equally comfortable acting as Product Manager and Product Owner. Familiarity with Contact Center processes and solutions is desired but not required. Your mission is to become the in-house expert and leader in this domain to guide the development of new functionality for both existing and potential customers, as well as guide the overall direction of our Business Intelligence roadmap.

Product Manager (BI) Responsibilities:
•                    Collaborate closely with customers and internal stakeholders to establish, socialize and implement product roadmaps.
•                    Serve as Product Manager, responsible for the Business Intelligence strategy and roadmap.
•                    Serve as Product Owner for our Business Intelligence scrum team.
•                    Manage product features and dependencies across multiple releases.
•                    Manage, prioritize and groom an active backlog for your products.
•                    Work closely with the architecture team, ensuring the system design and technology platform fulfills near and long-term product needs.
•                    Define and communicate requirements to the engineering and architecture design teams.
•                    Maintain the near and long-term product roadmap, communicating plans and decision making processes to management and other stakeholders.
•                    Be an expert and advocate for your products both within and outside the company.
•                    Work with Integration Managers, Customer Success, Customer Support, Customers and Sales teams to synthesize client feedback into actionable plans for your product(s).
•                    Ensure the highest quality product is delivered to customers.
•                    Stay up-to-date on contact center solutions to identify and evaluate new opportunities.
•                    Provide customer voice and context in product decisions.

Product Manager (BI) Required Education, Experience and Skills:
•                    To be considered for this challenging position, applicants must be able to demonstrate a majority of the following skills, knowledge and abilities:
•                    3+ years relevant job experience.
•                    A passion and understanding for how data informs business decisions.
•                    Excellent Agile knowledge, with a background in a Scrum environment, writing complex user stories and acceptance criteria, and managing team resources.
•                    Demonstrated experience as a Scrum Product Owner.
•                    Familiarity with JIRA, and preferably Portfolio for JIRA
•                    A communicator, able to work with different teams across the company and "translate" information between these groups.
•                    A strong technical acumen, especially as it relates to methods and solutions for large scale, high performance BI platforms.
•                    Big-picture understanding of the overall product direction and needs, with the drive and attention to detail that transforms that understanding into a reality.
•                    Strong analytical skills - able to provide creative solutions to complex problems within our integrated product suite.
•                    Ability to manage a high number of ongoing tasks and maintain an awareness of the current status for each project.
•                    Understanding of Big Data Best Practices and Technologies desirable.
•                    Knowledge of and experience with call center technologies is desirable.
•                    Experience or knowledge of predictive analytics solutions is an advantage.
•                    Excellent written and verbal communication skills
•                    Self-starter capable of working on projects independently
•                    Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, MIS, CIS, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics or equivalent

If you are interested in the Product Manager (BI) position, please contact Sarah Hodges at (678) 580-4061 or by e-mail at [Click Here to Email Your Resumé]

Synergis serves a myriad of clients across nearly all industries, from start-ups to Fortune 100 companies. From its foundation in 1997, Synergis has been successfully recruiting and placing IT professionals in all areas of information technology. Recently named the Best Place to Work in Atlanta by the Atlanta Business Chronicle, Synergis has been successfully recruiting and placing IT professionals for over 10 years. About Unisys

Do you have what it takes to be mission critical? Your skills and experience could be mission critical for our Unisys team supporting the Federal Government in their mission to protect and defend our nation, and transform the way government agencies manage information and improve responsiveness to their customers.  As a member of our diverse team, you’ll gain valuable career-enhancing experience as we support the design, development, testing, implementation, training, and maintenance of our federal government’s critical systems. Apply today to become mission critical and help our nation meet the growing need for IT security, improved infrastructure, big data, and advanced analytics.Unisys is a global information technology company that solves complex IT challenges at the intersection of modern and mission critical. We work with many of the world's largest companies and government organizations to secure and keep their mission-critical operations running at peak performance; streamline and transform their data centers; enhance support to their end users and constituents; and modernize their enterprise applications. We do this while protecting and building on their legacy IT investments. Our offerings include outsourcing and managed services, systems integration and consulting services, high-end server technology, cybersecurity and cloud management software, and maintenance and support services. Unisys has more than 23,000 employees serving clients around the world. Unisys offers a very competitive benefits package including health insurance coverage from first day of employment, a 401k with an immediately vested company match, vacation and educational benefits. To learn more about Unisys visit us at www.Unisys.com.Unisys is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) - Minorities, Females, Disabled Persons, and Veterans.#FED#

Business Intelligence Developer (Qlik)
 
Optomi, in partnership with a Financial Investment company that is integrating over 300 applications into their databases, is seeking a BI Developer that will be building out their Qlik dashboards and report visualizations in their Baltimore MD location. 
 
The Business Intelligence Developer manages and facilitates significant analytic initiatives in support of system strategic, operational and quality projects. Working in collaboration with facility executives, service line leaders and operational managers, the Business Intelligence Developer translates the business needs into analytic and reporting strategies, creates a plan to deliver those analytics then execute those plans for delivery.
 
What The Right Professional Will Enjoy!
·       Fully implement QlikSense visualizations from end to end!
·       Leads the on-going interfacing with the clients, to develop analytic approaches within a billion-dollar enterprise environment.
·       Work in a corporate culture with strong company values that puts its employees first!
 
Apply Today If Your Background Includes:
·       5+ years of experience in a Business Intelligence setting including analysis, development, and deployment of reports. 
·       Prior experience with Business Intelligence tools such as Business Objects, McKesson Performance Analytics, Tableau, Microstrategy, and specifically Qlik REQUIRED.
·       Full understanding of ETL and BI architecture as a whole.

·       Developing solutions: Directing and executing multiple, concurrent projects independent of or with little supervision. Also, you will be responsible to:

title: Business Intelligence

details:
Purpose of the Position:

Responsible for providing analytic support across the organization to enable better data-driven decision making and planning by senior management. As part of the ‘Business Intelligence’ function, the Analyst will assist with:


Establishing an enterprise-wide approach to data management.
Improving information accessibility and horizontal information sharing across the organization.
Creating a unified and integrated view of our core data aligned with main institutional objectives.
Streamlining manual report generation through a combination of automation and outsourcing/offshoring.


Primary Duties and Responsibilities


Play key role in cross-functional reporting and analytics efforts across multiple business units.
Identify reporting needs and create/improve daily, weekly and monthly reports.
Assemble and summarize data, make presentations of findings, and provide recommendations for cost savings and process improvement to senior management.
Conduct trending, forecasting, predictive modeling to identify patterns and get to the root causes.
Develop and maintain reports and metrics to track employee performance management.
Document and update existing standard operating procedures, process maps and org charts.
Standardize cross-departmental data definitions, KPIs, and calculations.
Share knowledge, expertise and best practices with new and existing analysts throughout the company.
Demonstrates knowledge of, and carefully follows all applicable federal and state compliance requirements and regulations including those prescribed by the Department of Education, accrediting agencies, CIE, and internal UMA policies and procedures.
Effectively communicates compliance requirements to students and other staff as appropriate and quickly escalates any compliance concerns to the Compliance department.




Skills & Core Attributes Required:


Ability to synthesize large amounts of data into snapshots appropriate for senior management use.


Ability to analyze data and understand business needs to recommend additional or improved ways to view the business.


Experience with creating dashboards using BI Tools (i.e. PowerBI or Tableau)


Ability to work with SQL databases (i.e. T-SQL)


Detail and deadline oriented, flexible to rapid change.


Strong operational, organizational, analytical, and technical skills.


Analytical thinker/mind-set with proven ability to solve complex problems.


Excellent written and verbal communication skills, specifically an ability to communicate effectively with senior management.


Proven experience with MS office suite including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access


Advanced Excel (formulas, Pivot Tables, Charting/Visualizations, Reporting and Dashboard building experience, VBA a plus)


Demonstrated ability to learn new computer systems.


Experience with financial and operational modeling.


Forecasting and statistical modeling (i.e. R, SAS, SPSS)


Flexibility to work evenings and weekends as needed.


 
Education/Experience Required:
 

Minimum of 1-3 years of experience in business, process, and operations initiatives. Advanced math and statistical skills.


Education Industry and call center experience a plus.
Minimum of Bachelors degree in Business, Economics, Math, Accounting or Finance

Strong organizational, problem solving and listening skills, attention to detail, innovative thinking and ability to inspire others required. Must possess a high level of customer service skills and participate as strong, collaborative team player. Working knowledge or experience in Microsoft Office tools and an understanding of computer system capabilities to address process requirements required.*CB
title: Business Intelligence
Business Intelligence

details:
Job Description - Business Intelligence Specialist
Business Intelligence (BI) Specialist

The growing Data Analytics group is seeking a Business Intelligence (BI) Specialist to work on our BI software and systems. This includes integration with SQL and external databases, supporting BI solutions to end users and senior management.

We are looking for someone with an eye for data visualization to illustrate the big picture, but who is also capable of cleaning up and organizing legacy data sets as part of an overall process.  Organization and attention to detail are a must.  Experience with either the legal or insurance industries would be an asset, but not required.  If you enjoy working with a team, but also are comfortable working independently to accomplish your tasks and projects, we want to talk to you.  

Primary Responsibilities

Develop and automate processes and data for company-wise dashboards.
Prepare data visualizations for internal and external use, using Power BI, web tools and PowerPoint. 
Research, analyze, and gather information from a variety of sources, including vendor databases, primary sources, web site sources, and print.
Assist with data clean-up and organization of legacy system data.
Create and maintain the data dictionary.  
Train end users to use self-service BI tools.  

 
Required Skills

Demonstrated competence with Power BI, Cognos or other data visualization tools, including creating visuals, building dashboards & customizations.
Expertise in building data visualizations with a strong understanding of the appropriate chart types to use to highlight patterns in the data.
Ability to analyze user requirements and build front-end BI dashboards according to specifications.
Strong oral and written communication skills, including presentation and graphics skills (MS PowerPoint)
Strong Excel skills, including PowerPivot, pivot tables & cell calculations. 
Demonstrated ability with SQL, DAX, R and/or M.

 
Education and Experience

BA/BS in Computer Science or related field is preferable.  Equivalent combination of experience, education, certifications and training will be considered.
2-3 years of experience preferred.
title: Business Intelligence

details:
Business Intelligence Analyst - Sales Operations
Position Overview 
The Business Intelligence Analyst will be a knowledge expert on a specific portfolio of clients. They are responsible for the collection, analysis, business insight, and publication and reporting on key sales and operational data with the overall objective of improving sales and operational performance as well as providing a data input into the business strategy and objectives/target set by the business.   The effective collection, analysis and presentation of this data is critical to enhance the understanding of the business and to improve decision making short-term and long-term.

Responsibilities
The Business Intelligence Analyst 3 will provide data in an informative state on an as-needed basis as well as against a defined business agreement with internal customers.
Roles & goals will encapsulate some or all of the below: 

Provision of bookings & revenue performance analysis against Plan and Forecast
Report on key business metrics vs. targets – opportunity and revenue, production metrics by client, by center and by region, benchmark with conclusions
Compilation of Sales Center forecasts for Sales Center Head and/or senior sales managers
Supporting the finance and executive team in compiling performance metrics required for post qtr. end deep dive   
Weekly headcount validation vs. plan and forecasts – FTE and Cost
Various reporting requirements e.g. sales incentive tracking, Performance review statistics, surveys, security audits, and others as required
Accurate accruals and invoicing supporting finance calendar
Lead the target setting and quota setting process for the Sales Teams in the Region
As required support the global team in the compensation and payout process
Publish team specific dashboards/balanced scorecards with key metrics and conclusions
Support the Account Management team in compiling insightful client team performance presentations and dashboards
Supporting the Sales teams with data requirements for different planning and operational asks
Lead statistical analysis on performance to drive insights / recommendations for the Sales team
Work with the Data Services team with tools that Sales and Operations Services can use to extract data / insights for daily business management in an automated manner
Report on and track Revenue generating programs
Provide mentoring and technical guidance to Junior Analysts in a specific portfolio

Job Requirements 

4-6 years practical business experience (preferably supporting a sales organization)
Experience with Tableau and ability to provide a portfolio of work for previous Tableau reporting builds
Prior background in inside sales preferred
Proven ability to perform complex analysis such as regression, forecasting and probability modeling
Experience working on multiple CRM and/or Information data repositories as well as Business Intelligence software (SFDC and Business Objects a plus)
Proven ability to capture and document business and reporting requirements from multiple sources
Proven ability to coordinate and manage simultaneous data analysis requests of varying size & scope

Additional Skills

Ability to identify active ways to influence KPI movement positively
Can modify and create custom metrics/KPIs for replicating our client's needs
Meets project timelines consistently with minimal to no supervision
Knows how to set reasonable expectations for clients that are aggressive but achievable through thought leadership
Consistently is proactive in identify potential grey areas in tasks, calculations, data management, processes, etc. and works to bring why there is a believed gap with a suggested path to resolve
Excellent communication and presentation skills – written and verbal with an ability to convey complex information to a broad audience
Proven knowledge and effective use of MS office applications
Demonstrated high level of proficiency in Excel. Able to create strong templates and best practices in place for reusability across clients. Can create dynamic workbooks to drive a complex refresh process that others can diagnose, understand, and use
Able to manage multiple Director-level stakeholders, plus significant client contact
Strong interpersonal skills with ability to work independently and within a team

About ServiceSource
ServiceSource (NASDAQ:SREV) is a global leader in providing outsourced, performance-based revenue growth and customer success outcomes. ServiceSource’s Revenue-as-a-Service platform is designed to measurably accelerate customer ROI by helping companies to more efficiently and effectively find, convert, grow and retain their B2B customer relationships. Trusted by more than 65 global market leaders in the cloud/XaaS, software, technology hardware, healthcare & life sciences and industrial sectors, ServiceSource sells, manages or renews $9+ billion of revenue annually on behalf of its clients. By leveraging a robust technology suite, predictive data models and more than 3,000 revenue delivery professionals, only ServiceSource brings to market over 15 years of expertise and the ability to drive recurring revenue growth in 35 languages to more than 170 countries. To learn more, visit http://www.servicesource.com.

Voluntary Self-Identification of Disability
Why are you being asked to complete this form?

Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire, and provide
equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities1. To help us
measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or
if you ever had a disability. Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you
will choose to fill it out. If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be
kept private and will not be used against you in any way.


If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way.
Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our
employees to update their information every five years. You may voluntarily
self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment
because you did not identify as having a disability earlier.

How do I know if I have a disability?

You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or
medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a
history or record of such an impairment or medical condition.

Disabilities include, but are not limited to:

Blindness
Deafness
Cancer

HIV/AIDS

Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair
Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation)

details:

 Creates system requirements, performs design and analysis, and coding and unit testing of complex to highly complex system functionality and / or defect correction across multiple platforms

details: The Kinetic Industry Product (KIP) team, for a Fortune 500 Telecommunications company, builds end to end vertical solutions, which include Kinetic - IoT Software Platform, IoT Networking, core products and 3rd party products. Kinetic is a System of distributed software that extracts data, computes data, and moves data to drive positive business outcomes for industrial IoT customers. KIP seeks a solution engineer as a part of our IoT Platform solution team with a proven background in architecture, software, networking technologies and implementation. In this role you'll design, build, validate and provide guidance for the vertical solutions on which you work. The Internet of Things is ramping quickly for this company, this is your opportunity to join an organization whose day job is the IoT.QUALIFICATIONS: * Reporting, analysis and management of a large scale data sets and developing data assets from a variety of new sources using Tableau and Qlikview.* Uses data concepts, tools and programming techniques including SQL programming, Historian Database, H2 Database Engine, Tableau and or Qlikview comparable platforms to perform ETL and data analysis activities.* Extract ,Transform, loading ( ETL) and Visualizing data for analysis purposes and to improve user experience and draw meaningful insights.* Engaging with consumers and stakeholders to define, design and deliver analysis and reporting solutions / dashboards.* Data analysis, cleansing, and validation for the purposes of understanding or making conclusions from the data for decision making purposes.* Ability to consume real-time data and Visualize it in a meaningful way.* Ability to develop Historical Dashboards in Qlik / Tableau.* Develop and provide documentation, training, and support for clients.* Participate in client meetings to understand project definitions and offer design reviews.* Determines appropriateness of data for storage and optimum storage organization. * Create, documents and implements standards as well as complex modeling and enhance the capacity and performance of the Tableau environments.* Good Experience with SQL coding.* Ability to diagnose and resolve problems independently with creative approaches. As a Best of Staffing® Client and Talent leader, Aerotek's people-focused approach yields competitive advantage for our clients and rewarding careers for our contract employees. Since 1983, Aerotek has grown to become a leader in recruiting and staffing services. With more than 250 non-franchised offices, Aerotek's 8,000 internal employees serve more than 300,000 contract employees and 18,000 clients every year. Aerotek is an Allegis Group company, the global leader in talent solutions.
